Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: princetongrad
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience in the H10 hotel in Mexico that I was thrilled to find that they also had a property in Rome. I stayed there twice on my recent trip to Italy and it was an excellent experience. To begin, the hotel is located in the Trastevere area of Rome. The area felt very safe since we took long walks at night without feeling uncomfortable or threatened. It is located however a little far from the touristic attraction nevertheless it is easy to reach center city since the hotel provides a free shuttle and the bus stop in not too far away. I found it very convenient to ride the bus (line 170) because it takes you to the Trastevere train station and also goes thru the mayor attractions of the city. The final stop takes you to the central train station (TERMINI) and the ride is only 1 Euro. It also rides nonstop until mid-night which makes it even better. To reach the hotel you can ride the train from the airport to the Trastevere train station for 8 Euros or use one of the shuttle services that take you from the airport to the hotel doors for 10 Euros per person. We chose the second option since we had bags and didn’t want to venture on the train. Also the hotel is about 15 min walk to the train station and a cab ride cost about 8 Euros so it makes sense to take the paid shuttles. Check in was quick and the facilities are incredible. Very comfortable rooms with WIFI and mini bar. It has a beautiful roof top pool that was closed during our stay but I imagine is extremely cool to use once it opens. We loved the breakfast because it had a lot of different options and it was an excellent source of fuel before the long walks in Rome. The staff is very attentive and friendly. They have a cool bar with late night snacks and a good selection of drinks. CLAUDIO, the hotel bartender was very personable and helpful; he remembered our choice of drinks even after a week after our first visit. He provided us with the best service by far in Rome. Overall I recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn’t want to be in the middle of the city and inundated by tourists. It will certainly be my hotel of choice for my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Real Rome”
Reviews.Author: ILoveGoodCustServ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, the 2nd time was as part of honeymoon!..could just end the review there I suppose. Its not in the heart of the city, but as long as you are reasonably fit that's a good thing as a half hour walk to town you get a good feel for town, and there are plenty of other options for transport. I prefer being out of central Rome as although its fascinating it is the cliched part of the city and you won't see much in the way of real Italian life. Not so near the H10..its a pleasure to find local bars and restaurants nearby, eating al fresco with the locals, then rounding off with a trip to the gelateria with 100 ice cream flavours! Great spot, nice pool, decent price. It is what it is, not a boutique hotel and somewhat 'business' focussed but it works for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mattwhitby
Reviews.Content: Comfy bed, bathroom was good and staff were really helpful. On site parking (albeit €12 a night). The only downside is that it's near a football pitch so you can hear whistles and people shouting and they do play late.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean rooms, nicely appointed, friendly staff, awful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: GoThere88
Reviews.Content: My stay was during December, 2011. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, away from public transportation, and outside the tourist area. We were told there is a bus stop several blocks away, but did not look for it b/c it seemed a waste of precious time to get directions, walk several blocks, wait for the bus, then figure out how to pay, get off at the correct stops, and find the correct bus to return. Taxis here are fairly inexpensive, and our eight people knew we could double up four to a car. Guests here ranged from honeymooners to senior citizens, all very friendly and quiet. The room was a $40.00 U.S. Dollar upgrade from the standard $100.00 room, for a total of $140.00. The upgrade cost was for a better bathroom and a larger room in a better location. The location on the fourth floor was nice, overlooking what I think was a soccer field, but very quiet and peaceful, even when there were people playing on the grassy field. Front desk personnel were attentive, smiling, friendly, talkative, generous with maps, willing to telephone tour operators at the places where the hotel gets a commission. They worked hard at upselling the hotel's amenities. The room was sparkling clean, pristine in fact! We had a nice large window that opened to catch the evening breeze. The room had decent size desktop- about four feet long, a combination safe in a cabinet with shelves, two tiny night stands with good reading lamps, and a sliding-door closet with room for a chest-level shelf for placing a large suitcase. There was a small chair in a corner, and a chair at the desk. The floors were spankin' clean hardwood. The bed covering and linens were fresh, crispy soft, and quite inviting. The room was tiny. The bathroom was beautifully appointed, very attractive to look at, all white and shiny clean pewter/aluminum; but just plain awful to use. Not one speck of countertop space for cosmetics. I'll never understand why hotels install the very inhospitable arrangement of pedestal sinks with zero user-friendly countertop space for personal belongings. I need space for makeup, cologne, special soaps, hair care items, pills, contact lens supplies, water bottle; and then there's my partner's stuff! The hair dryer hung on the wall, and there was no countertop to lay it on for easy pickup and put-down; I had to keep wrestling it back into its metal hanger in between brushing and drying my hair. The swinging glass half-door did not keep water in the tub, but it was nice looking and very clean. There was a mostly used roll of toilet paper and a very tiny wrapped spare; no tissues, and of course, in the European fashion, no face washcloths. Not happy with that arrangement, b/c who wants to pack up a semi-wet washcloth after showering on departure day? So very difficult to use this bathroom. The room had a window that opened & the breeze was wonderful, very pleasant in cool weather. This was a good room for relaxing after a long day, reading in the very comfortable bed with a good reading lamp. A couple with whom we were traveling had a suite, and it was huge by comparison; with a coffee maker, two televisions, and other amenities - worth considering. The restaurant and bar/snack area was enormously expensive for mundane food. $5.00 (over 3 Euros) for a tiny size glass bottle of cola, for example. That's simply gouging! However, the snack area was very comfortable, with an attractive bar, reasonably attentive service, and a good place for groups to meet casually to catch up on daily activities. Off to the side of the bar is a lobby lounge with large, comfortable chairs. The front desk person gives out free passwords to use the computers in this lobby area, but each time I used the computers the code was not even necessary. Internet was fast, computers were not in high demand, and the computer experience was good. The front desk staff - two different people at two different times for members of our party - told us there was no place to go nearby for coffee or breakfast other than the hotel restaurant which also serves full dinners. They even told two members of our group to wait 35 minutes until the restaurant opened, b/c there was no place nearby for coffee. Not true. Just 1 1/2 block away, around the corner behind the hotel, was a wonderful bakery and coffee shop. The coffee shop also served lunch and light dinners. The day we found the place they were serving delicious hot panini-like sandwiches; and of course delicious fresh pastries. The price was downright cheap, even by American standards. Breakfast at the hotel for our two unfortunate group members was $35.00 American - all b/c the front desk person told them there was no other option! Just a couple blocks more behind the hotel - a total of about three blocks - is Marconi, a fairly busy street, but definitely very far south of the interesting commercial area. And wonderfully --- there is a grocery market which is just three blocks from the hotel. It's a full market, like a small Kroger store, and groceries were reasonably priced. I suppose that's b/c it's away from the tourist area. For example, we bought an 8-pack of American Coca Cola for around $7.00 American. We also bought 8-packs of bottled water there, as the cost at the hotel was about $4.00 per small bottle. The free morning shuttle takes people into town, but fills up quickly and there seemed to be only one bus - by late morning we were told the shuttle had already left, and that there would not be another one. And... had we taken the shuttle, there was no option whatever for catching the shuttle back to the hotel. Once in town, you're on your own. So we called a taxi, and with four people per taxi, the cost was an inexpensive per-person cost, just under $20.00 American to the city. On our next rides to town we found that most destinations, such as the Collosseum, Vatican, and the main squares all were about the same cost. If wanting to use the hotel's free shuttle, I suppose it's best to inquire the evening prior, ask if it's possible to reserve seats, and if not... be early to get a seat. Bottom line: Spotlessly clean, bad location, tiny room, friendly front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great price, out of town location.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyH25
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely 4* hotel. It had all the necessary amenities; the rooms were clean, quiet and modern. It included lovely soft white towels, toiletries, a hairdryer, flat screen TV and even the necessary plugs to wire a personal laptop/mp3 player into the room’s entertainment system. Very impressive! The hotel is in an out of town area, south of Trastevere. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus to the town centre about 4 times daily. This service went at very convenient times and we never missed a bus! This hotel is a really great price compared to others of this quality in Rome due to the out of town location. We found the only downside of the location was in the evenings when we wanted to visit the lovely restaurants in central Trastevere. This was a 45 minute walk or a 12 euro taxi. The front desk were very informative and upon arrival provided us with maps, tour information and gave us tips on the best places to visit. All the staff were really helpful. We decided not to eat at the hotel due to the extensive options around the city so I cant comment on the food. Overall for the price this is an excellent hotel and one I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but it is their breakfast I loved most!”
Reviews.Author: Travelaholic_10
Reviews.Content: A very clean and comfortable hotel. We stayed there for two nights in Feb 2012, location is quite ok consideraring there are some row of shops in walking distance. I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel, and the hotel serves the best breakfast throught out my whole holiday in Italy, delicious meat balls, hams, bacons, desserts and bread!!! Really lovely breakfast! I would love to come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome......definately return to Rome and this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FrauBell60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best hotel I've stayed at in a long time! The first impression of the location is a bit daunting, in a back street. We never felt threatened at all walking to and from the hotel anytime of day. We were welcomed by the front desk staff who were very informative about the transport etc. The room was fabulous, we were three adults and the accommodation was more that sufficient. There were lots of lovely White towels ( changed every day if required) plenty spare pillows, free security safe, shower, bath, bidet and sink, toothbrushes and toothpaste, soap,showergel, shampoo, quality hairdryer,mini bar very reasonable by todays standards, free wifi,computer connections, big tv, the guest bed was very comfortable although not as comfy as the superkingsize bed, room service was also very reasonable,coffee making facilities, we never bothered to find out how to operate it as the breakfast in the hotel was exceptional we never felt the need for extra coffees! Every member of staff we encountered was more than pleasant and helpful. Our flight was not until evening, so we opted to leave our luggage in the hotels left luggage and return to the hotel and have a taxi take us from there to ciampino airport just what we needed. Nothing was a problem, so much so my daughters both said the hotel was just getting better and better!!! The area where the hotel is called Trastevere is an amazing town,no metro, however it has a train station, a good walk from the hotel. The restaurants locally were great. One called retro just around the corner from hotel and the other we found was rosa mosquita across the main road to the left of the hotel. I cannot rave about Roma citta enough and I can't wait to return with my husband! If I can help in any other way please get in touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not in great location”
Reviews.Author: sally j
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel itsself is very clean and the staff are very personable.. Our room was on the 1st floor (over the restaurant) so we could hear the tables and chairs moving. The hotel doesnt seem to have great noise insulation (we could hear the next door occupants phone vibrating!) The maids, whilst very efficient, can be noisy when cleaning adjoining rooms because of the lack of noise insulation. Because of the location you can catch the 170 bus into the main part of Rome (costs one euro) Would i recomend the Hotel ? Yes, Would we stay there again, probably no because of location and noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Oussama B
Reviews.Content: nice room ,easy parking,staff is nice and helpful wifi in the room but can be slow or even be cut and then you need to get a cable from the reception,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: victoria m
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. It was clean, new, chic-modern, great service and very affordable. Not too far from the restaurant district about $10Euros taxi cab to a great location called Trastevere. Its about $20Euros cab to the Vatican city and a great shopping area. Most tour agencies however will pick you up in the morning so its not too bad because the pick up price is included in the package. Don't have anything negative to say, I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a ok location but it pays off.”
Reviews.Author: fforbes212
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Roma Citta has major pluses ,and some minor negatives.Once you figure out how to move around Rome its perfectly ok.The hotels location was not a problem for me.It has some nice amenities that are hard to find in central Rome.For instance free WI-FI and a pool,which for me is a big deal when traveling.You can find more info as well as full review on the Hotel Roma Citta, and pictures on my blog Atravelbugg.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice low priced hotel, bad location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: tulsacats
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a package, so we did not chose it. It was clean, service was pretty good, but it's a long long way from the sights of Rome. A taxi or public transportation is a must, but if you're there during a public strike, you could be in bad shape. The property is very affordable, but you'll need the money you saved to get into the real city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svetle_CC
Reviews.Content: Stylish, rather new hotel with modernistic interior and attention to detail. Posh, comfortable and clean rooms, well equipped. Very pleasant, welcoming and helpful personnel. Upscale restaurant with great dining offers. Available parking within the hotel. The only setback is that the hotel is rather isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but isolated”
Reviews.Author: KGT888
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel with friendly, polite and helpful staff. Very clean and comfortable. Only drawback is it was at the wrong end of Trastevere and too isolated! Great hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business...”
Reviews.Author: amelie77Paris
Reviews.Content: I' ve been in this hotel last october a couple of nights. When we arrived the staff at Reception were not very efficient. The location for us was perfect because we need to to go "alla città del Gusto" of Gambero Rosso. The room was nice design. We had a triple and the third bed was a smal couch bed very uncomfortable. I slept bad. I' ve tried to make a coffee with Nespresso Machine but it was broken. Bathroom was nice design but we can see there is no good maintenance. It' s getting old. Breakfast offer a large choices of foof but from very average quality. We arrived late on 1st evening and we wanted to eat something at the bar. Don' t do it, it' s better if you walk 200 meters and find some other place. It' s not a bad place but when you book 4 stars you expect higher quality. Anyway If I have to go nearby for business I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRGNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights (Nov. 3-4) in this hotel prior to our cruise. It was part of the travel package, and am I glad it was! Brand new hotel in a residential neighborhood off of Viale Marconi. The hotel had free wifi, ice machines in the hall (yes -- it's true) and the included breakfast was way beyond continental--hot food, everything fresh, good service. While the hotel is not in 'city center' the #170 bus on Viale Marconi will take you all the way to Termini. Viale Marconi is packed with retail shops, there are two supermarkets close by and the wine shop on Via Pietro Blaserna specializes in wines of the region, and the proprietor is a very helpful young woman whose English is superb. We could want for nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: rickypickyricky
Reviews.Content: I recently went in Rome to attend a conference held in this hotel. My overall score is more than positive, it is a good hotel when you are on a business trip. Clean rooms, good restaurant and a fairly good choice of snacks at the bar if you are not very hungry (or you are in a rush). Free WiFi connection in the whole hotel (and this is important if you are there for business). The only drawback of this hotel is that maybe it is not easy to find. I went by train to Trastevere station (that is not the main station of Rome) by changing train at Roma Termini (the main train station) and then going by foot. It is maybe 10-15 minutes by foot. In order to reach the hotel entrance, you need to leave the main street and search for it. Nothing terrible, only not really immediate.

Reviews.Title: “Good, for sure, but somehow I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: bgls3000
Reviews.Content: There were two main reasons why I chose this hotel: It was rated in the top 10% on Trip Advisor, and because it had inclusive wifi in the costs. When we arrived (3 night stay) we were informed that the wifi was not working. I'd purposely not bothered with any guidebooks to Rome, as I was going to research everything on the web. By the following day, it was still not working. And only on the last day, in the afternoon, did they get the internet working. This was really disappointing, and we were offered no compensation. The breakfast was also not too great. I admit that there was a lot of choice, but nothing looked very appetising. Everything appeared to be dried out, or overcooked. The boiled eggs were boiled until blue. The bacon was undercooked and too thin. On one morning, the fruit looked like it was just too ripe, with grapes starting to turn brown. The meat cuts and cheese slices were OK but very ordinary. Cereals were OK. There were about 4 to choose from. As I said, there was a lot of choice, but some more effort could've been done with presentation and quality of the food. I know I'm being really picky, it's just that for the money, and for the rating it got on Trip Advisor, I was just a little bit disappointed. On two of the days, the lifts on our side of the building were not working. Not a disaster by any means.... but just giving the facts. The hotel was situated slightly further from the centre than i imagined... about a 12 minute walk from Roma Trastevere station. Now that I've done the moaning bit... I will also add that the staff were very welcoming and friendly, in the reception, in the breakfast hall, and the chamber staff. The room was quite large, and the bathroom was really perfect: Large, clean, bright, and white. Shower pressure was very good. The beds were comfy and there were extra pillows provided. Loads of wardrobe space, and a safe was provided. The mini bar was good, and the prices were reasonable, as far as hotel mini-bar prices go. Also, they had a free shuttle taking guests to the centre of town several times per morning, and a few times return in the afternoon, so the distance need not be a great problem. The overall feel of the hotel was very modern, stylish, trendy, and clean. But I do think that the hotel should've had a better contigency plan with regards to the non-working wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good quality”
Reviews.Author: vmalez
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel many times now. The hotel is very nice and people are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ben S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and it was an amazing experience. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly; the rooms are beautiful; the beds are huge and comfy; and the taxi ride is less than 10 euro to the centre of Rome! The distance from town is not an issue as there is a one euro bus just outside the hotel or a free shuttle operating during the day. This is definitely worth checking out!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - 15 mins from rome”
Reviews.Author: linda o
Reviews.Content: a really good hotel with all the facilities at a reasonable price. absolutely great time staying there. 15 minutes into rome via a bus link [good bus service we only waited a max of 15 mins for a bus day or night]. that is as far away as you would want to be. i would probably stay nearer rome in future but for anyone who would prefer to be away from the hustle and bustle with all the amenities the hotel offers it was good value

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: vanisher77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roma Citta for two days in the weekend. I can only give positive feedback about this hotel. The rooms were very good, the breakfast was excellent and the staff was also friendly and helpfull. On our last day they let us use the pool after check out because we had a flight back late that evening. Also the pool is really nice and feels great after hopping around a day in Rome. The only thing that you have to be aware of is that the hotel is not exactly located in the city center and that you must use a bus (good connection to Termini) to arrive there. If you intend to leave in the morning and come back in the evening this is just fine. If you need to come back a couple of times a day to your hotel I would choose another one. My recommendation : try this one out and don't worry too much about the location. Keep in mind that travelling from the airport to this hotel via public transport might take a while. We used bus + metro + bus which was quite a journey.

Reviews.Title: “You are 10-15 minutes from the centre of Rome- not a problem”
Reviews.Author: frenchconnector
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfectly acceptable location a couple of miles outside the centre. Yes, you can use the hotel's shuttle bus- which was more than a 16 seater, I noticed (perhaps demand had seen the hotel sensibly change the bus size) but we never used it. Just five minutes walk and you are at the bus stop ready to pay 1 euro for up to 75 minutes public transport- the number 170 taking you to Piazza Venezia right in the centre of Rome. Be useful if you can get the timetable for the number 170 - perhaps the hotel staff can assist but I reckon this bus is on the half hour. Our room was fine - huge bed and plenty space, good shower. Internet access next to reception for the Hearts results. Access to room not immediate as room not ready so luggage left at hotel and retrieved later in the day. No problem. Hotel is very clean and modern, staff helpful. Buffet breakfasts - hot and cold buffets excellent, cereal, fruit, pastries, staff very attentive and a good number in attendance at breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in August 2011, it is so beautiful :) The staff are very helpful and speak good english. The room was really nice and we found that room service was actually quite good value we got a big plate of chips, some pizza and pasta and some free bread buns (you do have to pay about €5 for the luxury though) There is also a fridge in the room (for the mini bar) - but if you find a cheapish shop and buy some water you might as well just store it in the fridge yourself. There is a shuttle bus that we caught that runs into Rome from the hotel - it only has 16 seats so if you can't get on there is a bus stop at the end of the road (turn right out of the hotel and walk about 100m and then turn right again until you get to the main street - about 250 meters away - then turn right again and walk until you see the bus stop ) i forget which bus you need to take but the hotel tell you this on arrival and give you maps etc. We also found a much cheaper way of getting back to Fiumicino Airport - we caught the bus to the train station and then just got the train right into the airport - we didn't have to buy train tickets before hand and no one asked us on the train so we basically got a free ride and saved about €50 on a taxi (that's what it cost us on the way down) - if we went again we would take a train and bus to get to the hotel in the first place as this would save lots of money. If you can get breakfast included then we would recommend this - it was so good! there was so much choice. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: An American living in Northwest England
Reviews.Title: “Outside the old city area, but a very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MJP-22
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is definitely outside the old city area of Rome. You can take the hotel shuttle, that runs four or five times a day (and returns four or five times), or go to the #170 bus stop at the top of the street, which will bring you into center Rome, or call a taxi. Having said that, I should also add that the hotel is in a wonderful neighborhood. All along Viale D. Marconi there are nice shops, patiserries, trattoria, banks, etc. and I enjoyed being centered in a non-tourist area. Tripadvisor's #9 rated restaurant in all of Rome is a block away (Osteria Mavi) and you are with walking distance to Piccolo Borgo, a great family-oriented trattoria that is well worth seeking out. If you can see advantages being off the beaten tourist track, try it. If you want to walk out the door and be in the center of things, look elsewhere. The hotel itself is great. We had a good sized room, very comfortAble bed and pillows, a terrific shower, in-room safe that was easy to use, a mini bar that you could put your own drinks in as well as those supplied. Nice flatscreen TV, with only 2 channels in English, but hey.... you get to watch old Clint Eastwood movies in Italian! I have travelled a lot, and this is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever visited. The entire place is spotless. The rooms themselves, bathrooms in-room and off the lobby, the dining room, even the elevators are spotless. Very nice. The front desk staff was very helpful. There is no separate concierge desk, so once or twice I had to wait til the desk staff finished checking someone in, but they were excellent. making dinner reservations and suggestions, calling taxis,making change, showing me the most efficient bus route to a museum, even calling to make a reservation for me at a museum. We ate one night in the hotel restaurant, which was certainly adequate for a night we didn't want to go out again- a good steak and nicely done duck, lots of seafood choices...but there are better and more interesting places to eat. I thought the breakfasts were great. A few kinds of eggs, cold cuts and cheeses, fresh fruit, juices, yogurts and cereals, just a nicely done breakfast buffet. We got breakfast as part of our conference room rate, and I suggest trying to get it included with your room. By itself, I think the charge was 17€ per person, which seems a little high. There is a very good rooftop exercise room, massage spa and terrific rooftop swimming pool, which was excellent until yesterday (Sept. 28) when they closed it for the season til June. I was disappointed to find it closed, but glad I had gone for a swim earlier in the week, at least. In the lobby are several computers in a relaxing area for guest use. Wifi at the hotel worked very well. There is a bar area in the lobby where you can get drinks, coffee, salad or sandwiches during the day, though the dining room itself does not open for lunch. So as a functioning place to stay, I would call this an excellent hotel, if you are aware of its location and willing to be out of the center Rome area. (

Reviews.Title: “It's very far from down town Rome.”
Reviews.Author: pp777pp
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It's very clean, but It's very small room even though there is far from down town Rome. It's very inconvenience area. If you'd like to go to Rome city, you have to wait bus and it takes about 30 mins!!! Sometime my husband and I were waiting bus for 1 hour and took 30 mins to back to hotel. it's lost time. If you'd like to enjoy in Rome, I recommend you stay in Rome area. This is not "Rome area". I'm not going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel... wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: traveler765
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and absolutely loved it! It's one of the few new/modern hotels in Rome, which is exactly what I was looking for! We arrived around 10AM and luckily for us, we were able to go to our room within an hour! The lobby area is very nice and has several computers available to use along with a restaurant and bar. The front lobby also has a luggage storage area for you to leave your bags if your arrive early or check out and still want to venture out. The staff at the hotel are also very nice and friendly. The rooms itself are very spacious and clean. The beds are very comfortable to sleep in and even though our room was facing an apartment complex across the way, there was no outside noise that was a bother. There is a mini-bar in the room with pretty pricey snacks and drinks. I believe a candy bar was about 2,50 euro. There was free wifi available and there was cable tv. The actual location of the hotel was great! There is a hotel bus that takes you to the city centre but we never used it since there is a local bus stop a couple minutes walking from the hotel that will take you to the centre within a few minutes. I actually walked from the Vatican to the hotel one day and it took about an hour or so. It was a very enjoyable walk because I walked along the riverbank and the scenery was very beautiful! Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I would definitely suggest this hotel to others!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: silverlake2002
Reviews.Content: If you would like a new experience this is it. A little out of the way but they do have a free shuttle bus to city center .You will love the pool with a view .

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: ShaunW1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early September. The hotel is located approx. 5km to the south of central Rome. A shuttle bus is provided however this only runs once per hour and is apparently quite small so gets full very quickly. We decided not to rely on it so used the normal bus service instead. This is cheap and takes around 30 mins to get to the centre. We also got a bus to the nearest Metro station which took us to the colosseum quite quickly. There is very little of interest in the local area. We found one restaurant which was pretty good - on the main road called Retro - but otherwise there was not much around so you are best advised to eat in the city centre. We drove to the hotel and used their onsite parking which was 12 EUR. There did seem to be a few free parking spaces on the streets nearby though. The hotel looks very nice and is very modern and stylish. There seem to be a few oversights in the design though. For example, the bathroom looks great and ours had 2 showers however there was nowhere to hang used bath towels. Also, there is an ADSL connection in the room which was great but there was nowhere near it to sit and use a laptop. Our standard double room was OK. It was a little small for the two of us but not too bad. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and had a great shower though some things in the bathroom seemed to have been installed by someone about 4 inches taller than me judging by the height that the mirror and toilet were installed at. Free wireless internet was provided in the room however this was very patchy with a reasonable signal only by the door to our room. Luckily, I had a laptop with me and managed to get the ADSL connection to work. To connect to the hotel network, you need to get a userid and password which is provided by reception and you need to login every time you use it which can get a bit annoying. There is a "business centre" on the ground floor however this seemed to consist of 4 old Dell computers with low res screens which when I was there were always being used by kids checking their Facebook status. I wanted to print out a couple of documents but there was no printer available. I was told that I would have to email the documents to reception and they would print them for me. Luckily, the documents were not confidential so this was OK for me however if I had been staying there on business, this would have been totally unacceptable. Breakfast is charged at 17EUR if it is not included in your room rate. For this price, we expected something pretty special. But it was just average.There was a reasonable selection of hot and cold food available but the quality was just average. We were also not keen on the room that breakfast was served in as it had the feeling of a canteen. As the breakfast was a bit of a disappointment, we decided not to try the restaurant in the evening. The pool on the roof is very nice to cool off in on a hot day however it is very small - less than 10m I think - so don't expect to be able to swim for a long time in it unless you want to know what a goldfish in a small bowl feels like. Service at the hotel was average at best. Most of the staff would say "Buon giorno" when seeing us however this had the feeling that they had been told to say it rather than of genuine warmth. This was also true when we checked in and the receptionist asked how our flight was but totally ignored the answer - we were driving not flying. When we tried the breakfast, the service was very brusque. The worst example of the service though was when we asked if it would be possible to get a kettle for our room. It was a little disappointing that the room didn't have one - but not too unusual for Italy - and we hoped that reception might be able to help us out. However they couldn't and rather than being told "I am sorry, we cant provide one" we were told "You can't have one. It is a security risk.". This particularly annoyed my partner who has a very low tolerance for BS and coloured her view of the hotel for the rest of the stay. The hotel is supposed to be a 4* hotel and for what we paid, we felt that it was very mediocre. It is unlikely that we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: stavross77
Reviews.Content: very good 4* hotel clean and modern but there is only a few sunbeds next to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, a bit remote from the city center”
Reviews.Author: mitzideluxe
Reviews.Content: Check in & welcome: went smooth, but we did not receive our room immidiately Room: was small, but o.k., unfortunately our bath tube did not work and was not fixed during our whole stay over 4 nights Breakfast: a little bit too expensive for the limited choice, it is better to go outside for a coffee and snacks Transfer to/from city center: transfer for free, BUT the bus just had 10-15 places and this was by far not enough, because there were always about >30 people queuing up Rooftop pool and bar: Nice ambience Value for money: still very good with reference to the price level in Rome

Reviews.Title: “I got home today, and already looking to book my next trip back !!”
Reviews.Author: Martin_A_manc
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was in two minds, thankfully i went with my instincts and booked this hotel, im glad i did !! The staff were extremely welcoming and the hotel was just a 10 minute walk from the station. Receptionists were very welcoming and extremely helpful on the hotel facilities and travel requirements. The hotel bus gets busy so get out 10-15 mins before departure to get a seat, but dont worry if you dont, the buses are very good and a 5 min walk away and only 1 Euro into Rome. If your looking for a clean, quiet and friendly location as a base then look no further than Roma Citta, if you live in the hotel room all day, then look somewhere else !! Its an ideal base as its quiet at night in the area and easy to get into Rome by hotel transport, bus or even to walk. Im looking to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, room and service!”
Reviews.Author: olesya_nixon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located pretty far from the city center (have to use bus - 15 minute ride - or taxi), no metro station nearby. But location is good for dining - far from expensive low-quality tourist spots, has a few nice restaurants close (for ex. Osteria Mavi is #22 out of 2770 on tripadvisor). Pool was fab - compact and warm! But not many sunbeds though. Our room was beautiful and clean, bed and pillows were the comfiest from 9 places where we slept during this holiday! Room maids don't knock before coming in though =) I would definitely recommend to stay at this hotel - location is quiet, hotel is modern, staff is helpful and pool is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel outside the city centre”
Reviews.Author: dannyjayadams
Reviews.Content: Pros: High international standard reception/services, great (though small and cool) pool, very comfortable beds, excellent modern rooms, free wifi. Cons: Location is not central to Rome and you will have to take a 15/20 minute bus to get to the sightseeing areas. Overall we enjoyed the stay and would consider staying again on future trips to Rome. Would recommend guests staying here to try the nearby Osteria Mavi restaurant, a welcome relief from tourist packed pizza places.

Reviews.Title: “No Wi-Fi and cold pool”
Reviews.Author: SDTravel128
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the Wi-Fi was down during our entire stay. There was no effort to remedy the situation, only empty apologies. The front desk had wired Internet access, all the manager needed to do was ask an employee to go to a local electronics store, purchase a wireless hub (less than $75), plug in the wired connection from the front desk and at least the lobby would have had Wi-Fi for guests to access. The pool is unheated and cold. Note that the hotel shuttle to the center of the city takes a siesta in the afternoon. The hotel itself is fine, rooms are nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “What Can I say...”
Reviews.Author: bpenley
Reviews.Content: Hello Everyone, This hotel was very nice, loved the roof top pool and the rooms were amazing. The staff were just ok, they could be a little rude at times. The internet was not working for more than half the week and every time I called they kept saying it would be fixed tomorrow. We had breakfast included, however we learned that if it wasn't it would have cost 17 euro per person, which was not worth it at all. Also they had a dinner for an obserd price, it was better to order room service or to go down the street to a Gyro place which had amazing food or Rosa Mosquite (sorry for the spelling) they had 6 euro pasta dishes and 5 euro bottles of wine, they were amazing alogn with gelatto & mozerella gelateria!! Hope this helps! Happy Travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned to Rome from the 14th to 22nd of August, and loved the H10 Roma Citta. It was the perfect place for us to stay. As others have mentioned, it's modern and the rooms are a great size. They do have wi-fi but we didn't bring a laptop, so were pleasantly surprised to find four computers with internet in the lobby for everyone to use. It is a little outside of the main part of the city, but getting to the sites wasn't an issue; we purchased a Roma Pass which included city transportation for 3 days and used both the city buses and metro, as well as the free shuttle to and from the hotel when possible. I actually really liked the neighbourhood that the hotel was in. It was neat to see a different part of Rome. There is a school, playground and several grocery stores nearby (rare in Rome!). There did seem to be some maintenance issues but I guess that is because much of the city is shut down for August. As others have mentioned - the revolving doors were broken (not really an issue because there were 2 others) and there was a large leak in the lobby which was weird. It was extremely hot this past week, so the air conditioning was a MUST! We only used the pool twice, but it is very nice. It was crowded once, but the second time we were the only people there. The breakfast is fantastic (as long as it's included for free). For lunch/dinner you are somewhat limited if you are at the hotel; I would recommend eating in the city centre. Room service was okay (but they add on a $4-5 charge each time so beware) and we did that a couple of times. The hotel restaurant only offers a buffet dinner beginning at 7:30pm, and this ranges in price from $20-30 per person. I found the staff extremely helpful. They all speak excellent english and helped us to call and confirm our shuttle back to the airport, and also printed our booking confirmation out for us. Overall, if and when we go back to Rome, we would most definitely stay at the H10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...would DEFINITELY go back! Roberto. P was very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_49
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on a number of hotels in Rome, I decided to choose the H10 Roma Citta for numerous reasons. We used the hotel for a 4 night stay in Rome, for a surprise trip for me and my girlfriend, on the dates 12th-16th August. The hotel is not in the centre of Rome itself, but is only a 10 minute bus journey from the centre. The 170 bus runs regularly from 5:30am until midnight, therefore there is no problem with getting back to the hotel, unless you are slightly unlucky to be in Rome when there are some diversions happening which causes the bus to miss a couple of the normal bus stops (which we discovered one night) , however, you- can simply go to the Termini, where you can catch the bus from, if this does happen. simple enough. The hotel does run a shuttle bus which ends at 7:30pm every day, so if you didnt want to use the public transport or a taxi, you would have to get back on this, and then enjoy the rest of your night in the hotel, or surrounding area, which when in Rome seems a bit of a silly thing to do. The hotel itself has a very modern and clean interior, which is very pleasing to the eye when you arrive, and throughout the duration of your stay. The only problem we had with our room was that our safe was not working, however someone did come to fix it but did not return, however, I think this may be because he said he would be back in 15 minutes but we had to leave, so he may not have been able to get back in, otherwise, the rooms were very nice, and the bath room was more of a wetroom than having a seperate shower, which me and my girlfriend thought was a nice touch, especially as it had two showers. The pool on the roof is slightly smaller than expected and is quite cold, but it is still a very nice addition to the hotel, as not many hotels near the centre of Rome have a swimming pool. The seating around the pool area can get a bit cramped, as there are a limited number of sun beds to say the least, but we always managed to find somewhere to set down our towels and sunbathe on the occasions that we did. The bar on the roof was also a nice addition and they do a selection of drinks, however it was a lot smaller than expected, and the downstairs bar seemed to be rarely open. I think this may have been due to the bar tender arriving at a certain time of day. Staff at Roma Citta, were always very willing to help, and would do there best to provide you with the best answer possible. Roberto P was particulary helpful with helping us find the quickest route to the Hydromaina waterpark, and for finding restaurants and cocktail bars in rome. He recommended us a cocktail bar in Trastevere called Express cocktail bar which was unfortunately closed. Breakfast was superb, there was a huge selection, and it set us up for each day to do whatever we had planned. However, the only flaw with the food at the hotel was that there was not as much choice at dinner. On our arrival we were hungry and went to the restaurant downstairs and discovered they only dfid a buffett. this is the only thing I would change, however, I would usually prefer to go find a local restuarant than eat in a hotel. The number of restaurants in the local area are quite few, unless you search around for them, or ask a member of hotel staff to point them out to you (which is what we did, and they were very willing to do so). The downfall is that most of the hotels in the local area only have italian menus or speak very little english (but I think this is part of the fun of going to a foreign country, to learn and do things like that) . However, we stumbled across a restaurant called AR VOLO, which although had everything in italian, did their best to get someone to translate the menu for us, and explain certain dishes. They also do an excellent seafood fettucini! All-in-all, the hotel was an excellent place to stay, and the transportation system into, and back from the centre was good enough to mean that the location of the hotel being slightly further out was not a problem at all. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would go back again. =D

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jesssssssss
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been any happier with my stay at this hotel! It is a modern, spotlessly clean and welcoming hotel! The only reason I questioned booking this hotel was it's location. However, although it is a little out Rome, the hotel provide a super comfortable, air-conditioned shuttle bus to the centre of Rome. Failing that there is a 170 bus stop a 5 min walk away which only takes 10 mins to Rome! The breakfast was absolutely beautiful and really set you up for the day ahead. The buffet style breakfast had a huge variety and choice for everyone!The decor and ambiance of the hotel was decadent. One of the main reasons we booked this hotel was because of it's pool. It was fab to head up to the rooftop after a day of exploring Rome's sights. There isn't enough sunbeds to cater for everyone so keep that in mind to avoid disappointment! It has a great gym aswell, slightly small but has everything you want! The hotel also provides a Spa but I didn't avail of it on this stay! The rooms were so comfortable, air conditioned and spotlessly clean! The mini bar was great and well stocked and the safe was so handy for passports etc! A great hotel, great staff and I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel near to Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_england
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and very clean. It has a small fitness room and spa and a small rooftop pool. The pool was not heated and there were never enough sunbeds but they often came available if you waited a while. Our room was kept extremely clean. We enjoyed the modern style of the room including a flat screen TV. The room had a safe and mini bar. The prices for the mini bar and room service was very reasonable. Bathroom was modern and the shower was powerful. Air conditioning was good and can be altered as required. Our rate included breakfast which was a range of food in a buffet style. Very nice quality food provided. The hotel provides a free shuttle into Rome though it was very busy and often full (only has 16 seats). The hotel provided a good map of the area and Rome centre including clear instructions of the bus service. The 170 bus is 1 euro each way and takes about 20 minutes into the centre of Rome. There are a few other restaurants in the area though we found a lot of the shops and restaurants were closed most of the time. I think this was due to the time of year. A lot of them had notices in the window giving the dates they were closed. The hotel said it provided free wifi but we were unable to gain access. The hotel reception was not helpful with this matter. There were also 4 computers available with free internet access. We would return to this hotel if we went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: kat1829
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel - super clean and modern. The staff were friendly and always helped if there was a problem or if you needed advice on how to get a round. The pool was an added bonus although it is quite small so you do struggle to get a seat. Was a bit far out from the city but it's no problem getting there. There are a number of options to get the city a) the free shuttle that is provided but this only goes up til about 6-7 p.m. b) the 170 bus for 1 Euro or c) a taxi - we actually used a taxi quite a bit and it wasn't too expensive. I would say on average it was 12 euro's to the city but between two people it's not too bad. Breakfast was lovely - plenty of choice and the fresh fruit was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and modern”
Reviews.Author: tinytrace
Reviews.Content: Easy to follow instructions on how to reach hotel from Fiumicino Airport. We caught the train which was 8 euros each and you have to validate your ticket on one of the machines before boarding. The stop you need is clearly marked Roma Trastevere and is about 20 minutes away. When you exit the station you can catch either the 170 or 766 bus at a cost of 1 euro each (you buy this ticket from the machine by the bus bays or some buses have them on board) You stay on this bus for 3 stops and get off at the stop 'Marconi' walk along til you reach the music shop, then cross the road keep walking down the side street past the pizza place and news stand and then take a left and you are at the hotel. The breakfast was good and had a good choice. The rooms were very modern and clean. The pool is on the roof and is small and there are not many sunbeds. Remember the tourist tax is 3 euro per night per person! They do provide a free shuttle bus at certain times we never used this as the bus stop is close and is only 1 euro valid for 75 minutes. The Tram station is also near the bus station and this is also 1 euro! At times these were overly crowded and we could not reach the machines on the bus/tram to pay so we did have several free rides as no one seems to check your tickets anyway. Someone told us only catch white taxis but we are not sure why as we never used taxis. We did eat in 'Pizza Retro' near hotel which was nice, this is near the sweet stand on the main road, the entrance is located down the side. The cheapest store we found for water and groceries was 'Eurospin' located next on the side street on way to hotel next to the pizza place, its easy to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Greek_sunseeker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel ,close to the center.We booked 4 standard double rooms between July 20-22 and we were very pleased. Rooms were very clean and modern . Swimming Pool on the roof was great but a bit overcrowded . Free wifi in the rooms and internet corner in the lobby were greatly appreciated . we would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Good option.”
Reviews.Author: pqi_royal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week with my girlfriend and the hotel was probably the best choice of us. The area of Trastevere is nice, but the main sights were further from the hotel. The distance to the town was a problem. The hotel offered free shuttle bus to the town, but the last shuttle back to hotel left at 700 PM. Then You had to come back by local bus and it always took almost an hour including waiting times. That's why I don't recommend this hotel for travellers staying in Rome less than 4 days. What comes to the hotel... Service was good and the staff was as helpful as they could. I asked once where to get stamps, but the girl at the desk only could tell one place (half a mile away) where they told me they don't sell stamps :) We really much enjoyed the pool and its bar at the roof and the jacuzzi (I hope You don't use jacuzzi with a brand new swimsuit, somehow my swimming pants changed their colour from blue to brown...). Hotel also provides ice cubes for free (functioning machine not at every floor, I had to go to another floor...) which was nice in summertime. We also ate breakfast there and it was okey. There was a lot of different sorts of food. Compared to other hotels in Italy I've stayed the layout was quite bland and odourless - totally basic. Generally speaking, we liked the hotel and would return there. The best place to experience Rome and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: verstraete
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, good breakfast. Friendly staff. Nice swimming pool area (although limited daybeds). Quit area. A bit outside the city centre, but there is a pretty good bus connection (bus terminal at about 200 meters). The hotel offers a shuttle service but there is only limited place for 16 people.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and quiet hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Imelda01
Reviews.Content: Is a quiet and nicely designed hotel. Very clean, with modern furnishings - but for for us (personal preference) was a bit too quiet and lacking in any vibrancy. However, if you want a nice quiet night in, with no fuss and to just rest after a long day out, it is just the thing. The rooms were quite spacious and beds very comfortable. The bathroom was quite nice with plenty of room - nice mirror and there is a proper hair dryer. Nice fittings throughout. There is a pleasant pool on the roof- although opening hours are limited as doesn't open early in the morning. Gym looked really good for those who want to keep up with their regime. Bar was pleasant. Breakfast was plentiful - though we would not recommend the evening buffet menu for dinner which is on at present at the hotel. We tried it and found it was very bland and not very good value - the waiter was very nice though - great service. We couldn't fault the service at any time at the hotel, by any of the staff. All are pleasant and attentive. Main draw back, as stated by others, is the distance from the centre of Rome. There was a shuttle bus and this was always full in the mornings, but the hotel was quite busy and there are only 16 seats. If staying for more than a couple of days the buses are very frequent and are nearby and although always packed they are easy to get on/off. Is a long and not a very pleasant walk to nearest metro-only found it by accident (though do go and see St Paul's Cathedral if you end up there, as was walk able from the hotel). Taxis are good - we didn't get ripped off. The shops on the main road near the hotel are all quite good, some quite pricey but there are the usual chain shops for good bargains and some interesting individual shops. There are plenty of cafes and places to eat nearby in what is a very busy commercial and residential area. Overall this is a pleasant and quiet hotel, that is good value, if you don't mind the extra trip into the centre of things.

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON HOTEL .....JUST THE BEST !”
Reviews.Author: nik1968
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed here in early July 2011. WE SIMPLY CANNOT FAULT ANYTHING with this hotel. Rooms brilliant, clean and well appointed and cleaned each day. ALL staff encountered were really goodand were very helpful. It is about a 17 Euro taxi ride out of Rome, but well worth it as loads of local places to eat if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of busy Rome. even after being home for a few days..we still cant think of anything negtive to say...and would recommend to all. Nik & Rachel Proctor.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: 26stastny26
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome with my family in June 2011. This hotel is not located downtown like most of the hotels, BUT there is a free express van service to downtown provided by H10 that has a pretty convenient schedule. The cleanliness of the rooms is fantastic and all the staff work was much appreciated. The front desk employees were pleasant, friendly and multilingual, which is convenient for visitors who don't speak neither English or Italian. The area in which the hotel is located is not at all touristic, so if you don't speak any Italian, it's practically impossible to purchase even pizza. However, the grocery store is located right next to the hotel (around the closest cinema) and all the cashiers speak basic English there. The hotel has a nice pool on the roof and the basic gym on the top floor. The breakfasts are very repetitive, so after a week of the same breakfasts, I started getting sick of having the same choice of food every morning. On the bright side though, everything that was served for the breakfast was great and delicious. When it comes to ordering a supper to your room though, be aware that a cost of the service may even overcome the actual meal cost. The only unpleasant issue I had with this hotel is the WiFi internet. The lobby computers had a great connection, but when it came to the wifi in the rooms, my laptop and my cell phone had a VERY low connection and I was waiting for each page to load as if I was in the 90's. However, overall, this is a great hotel and it is worth every penny you pay for a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent days!!”
Reviews.Author: NICKOLASATH
Reviews.Content: I just came back home from my trip in Rome and H10 Roma Citta. It was a great hotel, very-very clean, with very polite staff and extremely helpful! When we reached the hotel by taxi from Fumicino(39 euros) we were given maps of the city, which we used a lot! The first morning, we used the hotel shuttle service and reached the centre of the city(near piazza Venezia). The other days we used bus no 170 which was very convenient, because was close enough to hotel and went to piazza venezia. If u get out of hotel, u turn right to the end of the road, then right again to the end of via pietro blaserna and the then right to viale marconi and outside the pizzeria Retro(nice food,good prices) is the stop of 170! (about 6-7 mins walk). After u get out in piazza venezia, if u like wallking u can reach on foot all major monuments(colosseo, fontana di trevi, piazza di spagna,piazza del popolo, pantheon). We did it but its important to know that u have to make small breaks because the heat is much in summer! IAt nights we liked a lot to visit Trastevere, a traditional neighborhood with lots of bars and restaurants! If u want to get there u have to take buses no 170 or 766 and get off in stagione trastevere(its only 5 mins away). Then u take the tram no 8 with same ticket(1 euro) and get off in trastevere. Most of people get off there so its easy to know your stop. The reservation we did was no breakfast because we dont like to be pressed by timetables, so we used cafe amadei in via pietro blaserna in your right hand(5 mins on foot by hotel). There, we ordered cappucino, pastries and sandwiches for 2 persons, only 7 euros!!! The clerck there is very polite! we recommend that! When we left we took bus no 170, got off in stagione trastevere and took the train to fiumicino for only 8 euros. The destination is about 30 mins from the train station. If u want to avoid expensive taxis, we recommend that. Its easy and cheap way. Overall, our trip was excellent, the hotel quiet and comfortable and location for us was not a problem. We will definetely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim19861189983
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Good breakfast, clean rooms and a nice swimmingpool on the roof for refreshing. There is one downside: the location. It is 25 min walking to the closest subway/metro, and 15 min walking to the closest train station. Fortunately the hotel offers a free taxi service downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: thornhill2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed at H10 for a week and overall we enjoyed the experience very much. H10 is a very clean modern hotel. It is a great place to return to particularly after a long hot day of sightsseeing around Rome. The pool is located on the roof of the hotel and it is a very nicely designed pool, on the one end of the pool the water appears like is running of the edge which is very pleasant to look at. As well the view from the pool area is also very pleasant. In the pool area there are snacks and drinks available. The only negative about the pool was a shortage of lounge chairs which was the case when we were there particularly because the pool area was so popular with the hotel guests. The staff at the reception desk were pleasant however some of the people there seemed more knowledgable about things in Rome than some others. The hotel is a bit of a distance from the main sites in Rome but the public transportation is good so that is really not an issue. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would happily recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Clare-Boris
Reviews.Content: Was really pleased with the actual hotel but it is a bus ride away from the centre of Rome but would still recommend it. Getting to the hotel from Trastervere Railway Station was a bit of a nightmare as we were directed on to the wrong bus and ended up heading back to the airport! Fortunately no one checks your tickets (we didn't have one) so we managed to get back and get the correct bus at no charge! When you come out of the station you must get the 170 heading to Marconi, 3 stops and then get off (by the large book/record shop). Hotel was a few minutes walk from the bus stop. Cross over the busy road (Footlocker on corner), past school and then left. Hotel is easily visible. Check-in was easy and pleasant and the staff were helpful with explaining the transport system. The room was very clean, modern, stylish bathroom with great shower, comfy bed, safe, etc. Very pleased. Buffet breakfast was included which had a great selection and all very tasty. We didn't eat in the restaurant or have a drink at the lobby bar because we were out and about for most of the days and evenings. Did get to use the roof top pool which again was clean with comfortable loungers and a great place to chill out. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others but here's a few tips to make getting about easier. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus several times to and from the city centre but the 170 bus is very frequent. We bought a Roma Pass which entitled us to get into 2 sites/attractions free and then discount on many others plus free travel on the buses, trams, subway and urban trains for 3 days. Worked out great value for money, especially if you pick 2 of the most expensive sites to visit FIRST (do read the small print). We did the Colosseum and Roman Forum and then found we also got into St Angelo's Castle free too (might have been a fluke). You can get the train from Trastervere to the St Peter's for the Vatican (1 stop) which is simple but be aware of last times for all modes of transport as bizarrely nothing seems to run overly late! Some of the buses have a electronic display on them so you can see where you are but a handy tip is that on the bus stops you will see the areas listed with a number next to them, the number dictates how many bus stops in that area. We found this quite useful on those that didn't have the screen as it gave us a good idea of where to get off by counting how many times we stopped. 170 bus pretty much got us everywhere and then it's good to walk between sites such as the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc as the cobbled side streets are very quaint and sometimes have market stalls and great little shops and cafes. As for eating out, we tried Angelo's just down from the entrance to the Vatican Museum and it was awful. That's one to avoid. Hard Rock Cafe was really pricey for drinks but great atmosphere and food. Caught the subway home to Marconi but then it's a good 20 mins from the station but had no choice as it was late. Also ate near Piazza Venezia where the food was much nicer and the local street vendors do a nice slice of pizza and warm sandwiches in this area during the day. All in all we had a great time in Rome. Lovely hotel, lovely people, lovely city with it's ancient ruins and so much history but just very, very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very chic!”
Reviews.Author: JENP1_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel roma citta is a great hotel, really classy and chic! The food was lovely and the pool was refreshing and the rooms were super comfy and stylish. We stayed here as a base for a sightseeing holiday. The shuttle bus was brilliant and had no problems getting on it each day. The local 170 bus was also a great alternative to getting back or going into the city in your own time frame.The local bus is only 1euro each way...very cheap!!!! The city is easy to get around and the sights are truly amazing. If you want to go to lots of sights make sure you purchase a 'roma pass' this gets you into 2 main historical sights for 25euros and you can use the local transport for free using this...we unfortunately found out about this at the end of the holiday. Check out the Trasverie (excuse the bad spelling) area at night for street shopping and restaurants. Overall great, relaxing and chic holiday!!!! (Ignore others that said this hotel is too far out. It takes 15 mins to get into the city by car/bus, but at night you can relax knowing your surrounded by locals in a residental area away from the hussel and bussel oof the city centre) Also booked at click airport transfer car to and from hotel from airport. Great service and reasonable! Enjoy it here we did!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “contemporary, clean, but away from city center”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Bond_S
Reviews.Content: new, clean, with a touch of contemporary design in everything, located in the south, on the way from the airport to the center... some nice deals could be found... is a good option for a 4+ days stay, but if you are on a weekend only, rather get smth in the city center, otherwise you'd have to spend 20 minutes one way (15 EUR by taxi), and face the unfriendliness of taxi drivers, when they try to overcharge you as a tourist two or three times a standard price... the swimming pool on the roof opens only at 10 am, is pretty tiny, and the surrounding view is oppressive, don't count on it for a leisure time...

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel out of Rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: LDV15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Trastevere neighborhood. The closest metro bus access is the 170 bus that takes you directly to the centre of Rome in about 20 minutes. The cost of bus is 1 euro but honestly, we saw absolutely no one pay the fare. I assume the 75 mins validation period is being used via the honour system but no one ever checked during my 3 nights there so don't buy the Roma Pass for 25 euros if you really don't need to as it does not include the Vatican Museum and only worth it for subway system use and the subway does not take you to everywhere. However, you should go on the city sightseeing tour on the red double decker bus as they hit up all major routes and runs until around 6pm. It's easier than you trying to find your own way around if you do not like being lost as the subway is not very intuitive and lacks signage. The hotel has shuttle buses going to the colosseum area every hour or so with last bus back to the hotel at 7pm. We used public transit and not the shuttle as the main road for bus is about 5 mins walk from the hotel and the buses were pretty frequent with the last bus towards the hotel around 12am. Note that the subway closes at 9pm until mid 2012 right now in Rome. Also note that the public buses do not have AC and seats are very minimal! We upgraded to the superior room upon arrival for 20 euros more a day for the 3 nights. We were hoping for free upgrade but did not bother arguing as we were exhausted. The only difference between the standard and superior seemed to be the size (roomier in superior) and some complicated expresso kit that can be uses with the expresso machine in the room. I say stick with standard and no need for upgrade as the modern decor is consistent on both rooms. The washroom was standard size and the bed was pretty comfortable. The curtains were very effective and the windows were very sound proof! There was a lot of music outside our room during our stay but we did not hear the music unless we opened the door! They have facilities such as a pool and fitness room and spa but we were in Rome to sightsee so we did not have to use the facilities. The housekeeping was mediocre as they did not properly replenish the toiletries for 3 days straight. We had to request for additional soap bc the maid did not replace it for our entire stay and since the soap was small, we used it ALL up on our second night! Other aspects of housekeeping was fine. I really appreciated the modern decor of the room and the hallways as I always looked forward to having a peaceful rest after a long day exploring Rome. There is also a supermarket on the main street right beside the bus stop if you want to pick up any snacks or water for the room. The area seemed very safe even late at night and there are some stores around if you want to have a stroll in the neighborhood. Overall, we really enjoyed the clean and modern room but the location was not the best. We are young and healthy couple who likes to walk so we were fine but if you are looking for convenience, with young children or are seniors, I suggest a more central hotel even if it is a bit more costly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - with a few inconviences”
Reviews.Author: Neuman11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautifully decorated and room was very clean also somewhat spacious for being in Europe. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. If you are in Rome to see the city, you are a bit of way from the attractions and will need to figure out how to buy bus tickets for the local bus and not the H10 Hotel shuttle as it has limited runs and they don't run late enough to bring you back to the hotel after dinner. The hotel is located more in a living area of Rome that is by no means poor but by no means up and coming either. It's safe, but kind of dismal. I do wish we would have paid a little more for something more in the city walking area. Also check out rooms in Borghese-beautiful! COFFEE- Holy cow the H10 is stingy when it comes to coffee, there is no coffee maker in your room nor is their the opportunity to go to the restaurant and or room service and order a cup of coffee. We had to pay $17-$23 (that was not the euro) for the morning breakfast if we wanted a cup of coffee. Coffee in Italy is a different experience, there is no such thing as a cup of coffee to go.. you find a cafe which is a walk away from the hotel and stand at the coffee counter and drink that tiny cup of joe very quickly. LADIES & Bathrooms, ladies if you are modest about using the bathroom with your man in the room, this is not the hotel for you nor are many others in the country.. The bathroom door in the H10 is rolling glass door with no hinge or lock.... I did not like this set up and we discovered this at a few of the very americanized Hiltons we stayed at while in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “At last, an American-sized room in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: nohasslespls
Reviews.Content: Most 3-star Italian hotel rooms are small to tiny, with claustrophobic shower space, no English cable channels and very thin walls. Granted, this is a 4-star one but the price difference is negligible when you're getting American-sized rooms, English cable television, a full bathtub, and a quiet sleep! The location is great as it is very near the 170 bus route (just two blocks away) which is the bus route you take from the Termini Station (main train and bus station). I'm staying here the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended and very modern”
Reviews.Author: snoopy040Tampa
Reviews.Content: There are 5 of us in the group after a cruise, the hotel is very clean, modern, big and clean. Although it is not in the city center, but public transportation is easily assessable and taxi to city center costs only 14Euro for 5 of us. There are a few restaurant near by. The hotel is in a residential area and we felt very safe walking at night. I highly recommend it and will definitely stay there again if we visit Rome in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeeluu
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern hotel, newly renovated. All facilities are quite well. Stuff is very friendly. Breakfast is great, but too expensive. As hotel located rather far from city center, there is no good alternative to have breakfast in. Everything was great during my stay there, except its location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MsLilyV
Reviews.Content: Location > The hotel is located around 15 minutes drive by bus from the citycenter. You have public busses around the corner every ten minutes, but there is also a bus from the hotel to the citycenter 6 times a day (9am, 10am, 11am, 3pm, 5pm and 7pm) and back. Public transport is very cheap in Rome. You can go to the center for only 1 euro. If you plan on using the public transport for a few days, you can by tickets for unlimited use for 1, 3 or 5 days. > In the neighbourhood you can find everyting: clothesshops, souvenirshops, supermarkets, places to eat.... > the trainstation Trastevere is 800 meters away from the hotel. That is a 20 minute walk, but again there are busses every few minutes > People always try to stay in the center of Rome, but keep in mind it is very noisy. We enjoyed the silence of this hotel outside the center. Rooms We booked a standard room. It is great. Interior is very modern and new. Beds are good, Airconditioning, Television, wooden floor in the room, carpet in the hall, safe, minibar, telephone, desk, internetconnection, bathroom with bath and shower, hairdryer, toilet & bidet. No terrass. Posibility to order roomservice. Smoking is not allowed anywhere in the hotel. The doors close automaticly and they close hard. Sometimes at night you can hear it very good. But it is not a true issue. Service Very friendly people working there. Willing to help. Knowledge of Engelish very good. Restaurant Food in the restaurant is very good and not that expensive. We paid 44 euro for 2 meals (one fish, one meat), a bottle of water and two glasses of wine. Breakfast Very good. A lot of choice. Only disadvantage: eggs were not that warm anymore. Beatycenter Free: swimming pool, yaccuzzi, fitness To pay: massages We had a hotstonemassage (69 euro), and it was amazing! Internet Next to the bar you have 4 computers for the guests with free internetconnection. Bar Very moden comfortable bar.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ahti
Reviews.Content: H10 Roma Citta is a gem: near perfect, with only location as a possible downside . So what's the location: it's Marconi, an unfashionable humdrum innner city neighbourhood. So you can't walk out the door and head into fasionable Rome: that's 10 mins in a cab away, or 20 mins by bus, or by the hotel's own shuttle. But the location has a plus: the hotel's on the back streets, in the middle of housing: there are no main roads close, so it's quiet. That's amazing for Rome where most hotels are noisy. This isn't. And there's another hidden plus: the hotel is 200m from the bike path by the side of the Tevere, so it's perfect for anyone with a bike. Location aside, what's on offer: a stunningly modern hotel. My room was close to perfect: immaculate decor, everything functional, with a desk you can work at. Terrific. Real style on show: Catala, of course. Staff pretty good. Facilities above average: great gym, pool, nice public spaces. Wish all hotels were this good. I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_cps
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on a Friday night. Quick check-in, polite staff. Lobby very modern looking and clean. For my surprise there are free transfers from the hotel to the downtown, so you dont need to pay for a taxi. Thumbs up and already a nice surprise upon arrival. When up to the rooms another nice surprise, super new rooms, Nice decoration, extremely clean and confortable. Bathroom also extremely clean and Modern. Overall if you're looking for a new, nice, modern and confortable hotel in Rome, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice hotel... a little out of town.”
Reviews.Author: Wuggi91
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month with a friend. We took a shuttle from the airport that dropped you off at your hotel. For two people and two suitcases it was €35. It was well worth it to not have to use public transport to get here. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful with everything we needed. They gave directions when we needed which was great! We needed a new memory card for one of our cameras and they advised us on where to get one for a good price. We walked to the train station the first morning which was kind of far and switched to the bus the next day. We used the 2nd shuttle into town one morning it was full, but everyone got on. We took a bus home every night for just €1. The room wasn't huge, but good sized for a European hotel. The rooms were very up to date and comfortable. We were in hotels for two weeks and I slept the best here! There was an AC adaptor in the room. Like someone else said the rooms aren't sound proof.
