The only trouble we had was in the morning it was very loud when people were leaving their rooms. The doors slam when you shut them and you can here them all the way down the hall. The pool was closed but looked very nice! There were computers downstairs to use, and free wifi throughout the hotel. We had a very nice stay and I would come again!

Reviews.Title: “Far away from rome. Dirty room.”
Reviews.Author: BiagioArevalo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in our europe trip. this was the worst 4 star hotel during our vacations. A nightmare trying to get to the hotel using public transportation. the brakfast was ok and the hotel is less than 2 years old. When we arrived, found a bug smashed in the wall next to the TV and hair in the bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good but the staff let it down.”
Reviews.Author: keeks85
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided to stay at the h10 roma citta for our first visit to Rome which was our last stop after travelling Europe for 2 months. The hotel itself is a standard modern buisness-like hotel. The room was very small but comfortable and clean.We did have trouble sleeping as the rooms are not sound-proofed very well, as we could hear the couple in the room next to us being''intamate''.They have a rooftop pool and gym which was quite good and a good selection of food for breakfast. This would have been a good stay, if it wasn't for the extremely rude staff. We are a young Australian couple and we are very polite to people and always say thankyou and please with a smile on our face.But every time we asked a question, directions,bus times, ect. We were given a short answer followed by a up and down stare. Even when we would come home from dinner and would walk in to the lobby we were greeted with not a friendly hello or even chow but a rude stare and it was mainly female staff. This is such a horrible way to act towards guests and made me feel uncomfortable. I also found that my italian is not the best and being a hotel speaking english would be ok, there was lots of Aussies,Americans and british guests there too. But i always got a confused look when i started to speak....i really don't know where this attitude comes from. This is a real shame...and by the looks of some other reviews they are stating the same thing. So maybe it's time to be friendly when working in the hospitality industry....it's your job!!!!!!!And one last thing the location is not convienient at all...way too far and the hotel bus stops at 5pm, so don't think about catching it for dinner. I would not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fresh and friendly hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RandB2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new and has a very modern feel, not to mention immaculately clean. Its south of Rome, just a little way down from Trastevere but easy enough to get into the centre of town. They have free shuttle that runs a few times a day but there are also local buses (number 170) and 2 train stations that are about a 5-10 minute walk away that connect to the major lines. We ate breakfast here twice and whilst it was a little pricey (17euro p/p) the selection was fantastic! The staff were very friendly and professional and spoke fluent english. There was a pool, spa and gym facilities all available on the roof of the hotel all in excellent condition given they are so new. All in all it was a fantastic experience if you're looking for a modern, well priced Rome hotel. We'd definately return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: danlea2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and modern, little way out of city but a free shuttle to city was a help, only 16 seats non reservable. We got on every time we wanted too. 5 ,minute walk to bus stop which is 1 euro per trip straight into the middle of the city. we used taxis regulary as the public bus was busy and packed, watch your pockets!!! a taxi to the centre in 12 euros slightly more at night. The staff were very freindly (the free shuttle bus driver likes to oper the door himself though!!) the staff were good at english and always willing to help with directions, calling for a taxi, of recomending areas to eat. The restaurant looks clean and going by the breakfast i would say the meals are probaly very nice although we eat in the centre. Also the swimming pool was shut which was a bit disappointing but we can only imagine that when it is open it will be amazing as its a roof top pool with jacuzzi!! Would recommend to anyone and am sure you will be happy statyin here!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Hotel in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: cruisefreaks
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this hotel at this moment. I was very surprised by how new and modern it is. It has very up to date Euro style, fixtures, furniture, etc. The room is not large but very well appointed and comfortable. It has everything a traveler could need, including a dental kit and shaving kit in the bathroom and shoe horn and polisher in the closet. There are extra blankets and pillows in the closet and free Wi-Fi in the room. Breakfast was included in our rate, a full buffet which is 17 Euros per person if not included in the rate. We took a taxi to the city center for under 12 Euros this morning but came back on the bus for only one Euro each this afternoon. The bus line is about a three-block walk from the hotel. There is every kind of shopping and restaurants within walking distance too. Overall, a very good place to stay, out of the city center but only a short bus or taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelpster
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as part of a pre-cruise package and loved it! Very modern and clean. Great selection of food for breakfast, lots more than the usual fare in a buffet spread and very tasty, tool We dined in their restaurant for dinner one night and the food was very good. The neighborhood is very quiet and we slept well. We used their business center for the access to the net and the computers had a fast connection. It's about 10 minutes by car from the tourist areas of Rome but as others have mentioned, there are lots of options to get there. And the rooms are great value for money, the lower price merely because the hotel is not in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable, very clean, new building, great value”
Reviews.Author: Aldwaik_Elmarmari
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed in "H10" when we went to Rome. Internet: Everything on the website is true, the internet was free and very fast. Room: We both have allergies and my wife is asthmatic so a clean room and a good ventilation system is a must for us. We were not disappointed, the room was extremely clean, ventilation system excellent. We got the upgraded room for 20 euros a day, the space was worth the extra money, not that the standard room was small, but I like to have some more room. They have a relatively big flat screen which is provided with an VGA cable, I was able to connect my laptop to the screen and watch few things from it. Food: before going we read some reviews on trip advisor that the eggs were runny, well they were but the chief was very nice and cooked them extra for us every day. The sweets were heavenly. we advise taking the breakfast package as it was totally worth it (selection of cheese, bread, butter, jam, eggs (boiled, fried, scrambled), ham & sausages (didn't try it), selection of pastries and 3 to 4 different kinds of cake. Staff: helpful and nice but would not go an extra mile to help unless you asked them to. Location: the hotel isn't near the center of Rome or the attractions, but this was covered by the shuttle bus (every three hours) that takes you to the "teatro de Marceleo" which is very near to almost all the attraction (20 minutes walk max to the furthest attraction).if timing of the shuttle bus isn't convenient for you then take public transportation (bus route 170) which is 7 minutes walk from the hotel, it takes from 15 to 25 minutes to get to "Piazza de Vennezia" which is again in the center of all attractions. the area of the hotel is a friendly one and gives you the feeling of a safe neighborhood, a lot of shops around where my wife spent a lot of euros on the sale :)

Reviews.Title: “A bit luxury in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: BeckyWebster
Reviews.Content: Roma Cita is a fabulous hotel. We were surprised at how far out from the tourist track it was BUT that was also an advantage as you got to see Italian life for real rather than the tourist trap. The staff were friendly and very helpful the food was very good quality and not too pricey. The shuttle bus was a brilliant service, also convenient that the hotel was on a main bus route that ran to the Termini (170) and taxis were not expensive. I would recommend that you get a taxi direct to and from the airport as it worked out to be cheaper than getting a train then a taxi. It was a shame that the swimming is an outdoor one as that would have been a nice way to relax in the evening after all the sightseeing and walking we had done. I would now be interested in visiting other H10 chain hotels to see if they met with the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, with some difficulties finding the hôtel at the beginning”
Reviews.Author: franco-libanese
Reviews.Content: This hôtel is excellent, great staff , rooms, new décor, and the breakfast was excellent. It was difficult finding the hôtel at the beginning , especially that the lady at the tourism office told us to take bus 170 and go down at Marconi stop. But the problem is that there are more than 5-6 Marconi stops, we went down at the first one ( without knowing there were any others) and spent more than half an hour before finding the via pietro blaserno , my advice to the ones who wanna take the bus 170 fromTermini , go down at Marconi-Fermi stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but off the track”
Reviews.Author: flyingfox007
Reviews.Content: The H1o is a real convenient place to stay. Its location in Trastevere is not great. 15 minutes walk from Trasvetere station, where you can get access to the tram, which seems to be the best way to the city center. The hotel offers hourly shuttle service to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: homerobscura
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful if a little far out of town. The plus side is that there is a courtesy shuttle to the main city but it is limited to 15 people on a 'first come first served' basis. The hotel is extremely clean and tidy with very courteous staff and the rooms are spacious and clean. The only down side is that the walls can be a bit thin if next door decides to use the built in ipod connection... Having said all that, it is just off a main bus route and if you don't fancy paying £15 each for breakfast, there is a wonderful cafe 200yds away which does a very nice continental coffee and pastries. A good value hotel in a quiet location with a nice (but small) roof top pool and gym....

Reviews.Title: “Just what the Doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: fun_bun69
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is very clean and the staff are friendly. The lobby is well designed with the spacing and allocation of the areas. The rooms are spotless (hardwood and tiled flooring). Plenty of closet and drawer space. For a person who is extremely particular about hotel bathrooms, this is the first time I would have felt comfortable taking a bath in the tub/shower. The beds were comfortable with plenty of extra pillows and blankets in the closet. The bonus is the free WiFi access; no issues with connection and no issues with speed. Is it far? It is not close to the major attractions. However, we were never more than 20 minutes away (via mobile transportation). The hotel provides an excellent (free) shuttle bus service. It is within a five minute walking distance to the bus line (making the Roma Pass useful). Plus, sits just a few blocks off the trendy main street. Average cab fare was 15 Euros (with and, sometimes, without tip) from any attraction point to the hotel. I would recommend taking a business card with the hotel's address - from there cabbies are quick and savvy in getting you back. The only sticking point was the food service. Despite what the information sheet indicated, there is no breakfast room service. Breakfast buffet (30 Euros per person) was not worth it. As we were ill at this point on our trip, half baked bacon and runny eggs were not appealing. If planning to dine in the hotel, I would recommend the "bed and breakfast" package. In general, room service is inexpensive and worthy after a busy day walking. Staff are incredibly professional and approachable. Had available umbrellas and were not too concerned with taking our room number. Overall, I could not gush any more than I have about our extremely comfortable stay (and this coming from a couple who were ill).

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Stylish, but Far From the Main Tourist Spots”
Reviews.Author: BeerYamamoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first visit to Rome. The room was very clean and stylish, but the bathroom was not very practical. There is not much space to spread make up, etc. so a little inconvenient, but it is well lit. The Staff here seemed OK, not outstanding. Another inconvenience we came across was that they stopped serving room service at 10:30 pm. We arrived from the airport late at night after a long hours of flight, we were hungry and exhausted, but we were forced to go down to the lobby bar to grab a bite. It is an OK value for the money, however the hotel location is sort of out of area where all the actions were so we wasted a lot of time trying to get to the train station, etc..... If we come back to Rome, I don't think we will stay here again. The hotel itself is fine, but the location is the deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, far from centre, internet only in lobby”
Reviews.Author: rutson
Reviews.Content: Title really says it all. With internet which works in the rooms, this hotel would be great value. No maintenance at the weekend so no fix. Not got for a weekend stay!

Reviews.Title: “A place you land up calling "home"”
Reviews.Author: Guixols2010
Reviews.Content: Since we first stayed at the H10 Roma Citta, back in September 2009, it has become an addictive habit. I keep returning to Rome for work and the H10 is a no-brainer. We have clocked up three months there and it looks like we`ll pack in another two before the end of the year. Sharp modern, and four stars (plus) at the price of three. Being new and well-managed the rooms and common areas are well-designed, attractive and clean. The staff are bright and professional. The pool, beauty salon, and gym on the roof are a bonus. The location is the reason for the discount price. A 1960s working class suburb, no way swish, but great for Oxford Street - type shopping and real local restaurants. Travel to the centre (where I work) easy; a 15 minute bus ride and four stops on the tube (all for one euro) and I was at the Circo Massimo, near the Colesseum in just over half an hour. The beds, by the way, are GREAT! I knew the hotel had got to us when we started calling it "home".

Reviews.Title: “all new and shiny”
Reviews.Author: ChemOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for my final 4 days of a 2 month Italy trip. I had earlier seen most of the big sights of Rome, and wanted to (1) relax (2) eat (3) enjoy a little luxury (4) shop (5) see some of the smaller sites of the city. OK. I picked it because it had a pool, was in the city, and was reasonably priced. The neighborhood is great (safe) and surprisingly turned out to be perfect for shopping. Not the high-end tony shops around the spanish steps shopping, but great Italian design I need some new clothes for work kind of neighborhood. Location: It's not convenient. Plan on occasionally getting a taxi. It was easy to get to the historic core on the bus. Getting back was a pain, and not sure how you would get back late at night. So we took a taxi back home usually. Oh, the hotel? It is as nice as the best reviews you see here. Staff is impeccable and so nice and helpful. I eat toast (and espresso) for breakfast, so the lavish breakfast was wasted on me (I had paid for it with the reservation). did I say lavish? try over-the-top. If breakfast is a priority in your life, BOOK NOW! :) Is it as fun as staying in the historic core? Nope. Is it nicer than what I need? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - interesting area”
Reviews.Author: FAP12
Reviews.Content: The H10 Citta Roma in Rome was a very modern hotel in an area that gave you the feel of being in Italy. Some might think the area isn't good, but everyone was friendly and we walked around after dark without any problems - not much for eating venues though. Close to decent bus lines and they also had a shuttle. The breakfast there was the best of the 4 hotels we stayed at during our trip - great! Manuela and Francesca were great hostesses and I could see that Marco was working very hard (especially when by himself on Sunday morning)! The hotel could use a true concierge, but again the staff were great! The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Thanks for the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Lonely Location”
Reviews.Author: lovinlifecanada
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. We had arranged for airport pick-up ahead of time (through the hotel) and were happy to see our driver waiting for us after the long flight. No complaints at all about the Roma Citta itself. It was very clean,nice amenities, friendly staff. Special thanks to Frank (who is "famous in all the world" ) for being so helpful and sharing his beautifil smile. We used the hotel shuttle each day to get us closer to the city centre. The location of this hotel is remote and in a desolute-looking area.We also used the local 170 bus to get around. Due to the location there literally are no restaurants in the vicinity. Ate at hotel restaurant one evening but it was very expensive. Breakfast was included with our room and was of good quality and variety. The coffee though was terrible. Roma Citta was a good choice for us,except for the location, and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Escape the tourist madness of central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night en route home. Lovely hotel, fanastic room, great amenities. The best part was how quiet it was at night, a rarity in Rome. The neighbourhood is friendly and local with great shops and cafes. A bit of a hike to Trastevere, but easily accesible by tram or bus if you're not up for walking. Free shuttle to and from the centre offered by the hotel. As well as complimentary wifi. Got a great rate on the room through Expedia, but no breakfast. At an additional €17, I opted out.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Skotti56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only on the way to the airport. In all honesty, I am very bemused by the positive ratings for this hotel. The location is not at all useful, being neither in the city centre, nor on the ring road for easy access to Fiumicino. The immediate surroundings of the hotel are not at all attractive (down at heel suburban area) with little in the way of interesting bars or restaurants. One of the reasons that we chose the hotel was the pool, but please don't be fooled. It is an extremely small rooftop plunge pool and was crowded during our visit. We had booked the suite and it was nice enough. However, there were no glasses in the room and although there was a Nespresso machine, there were no capsules and no cups. My family and I travel extensively and we usually find tripadvisor to be a very useful resource when booking accommodation. On this occasion, however, I really urge you to look beyond the other reviews. Rome is one of Europe's greatest cities and you really cannot experience the best that it has to offer if you stay here. My major gripe with the hotel was the service. Check-in was both inefficient and rude as was the check out procedure.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: WoldTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: When first driving up to the hotel, we asked oursleves, where are we going??? The neighborhood seemed a little run down, but with the Hotel and surrounding buildings , it seems that it may be in transition. Very comfortable, modern, clean room with half walk in shower. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby with Carlsburg beer at 7%. Rooftop pool very chic but would be more impressive if it was closer to the city. However, this being said, shuttle service is offered to the city center of Rome and the bus is just a 5 min walk away from the hotel. Be aware of where your stop is because it is not always indicated, especially at night time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE and FREE WIFI!”
Reviews.Author: poshaggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Sept. 2 through 9, 2010. It was great...a little far from town, but great. Staff is extremely accommodating and will get you anything you require. Our room was very quiet and we slept wonderfully. Bathroom is plenty big (by European standards) and they supply nearly everything you need, such as the standard shampoo, shower gel, lotion, hand soap and they also give you a shower cap, dental kit, shoe shine stuff, comb and I think that's it. The hotel bar was great and the bartender was awesome. We really enjoyed his company. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but it seemed like a good place to grab a bite....the breakfast display looked awesome as we walked out the door. We took a taxi to get where we needed and paid anywhere from 9 euros up to 35--which took us to the airport. Don't worry that it's a little out of the way, it's a quite neighborhood and the taxis are fast and the hotel can call you one and it be there within 3 minutes, literally. I was glad that it was not close to all the touristy areas because it made for a good sleep due to the quite neighborhood. I NEVER felt unsafe and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know going to Rome. Plus, it's like 3 blocks from an ATM which is a plus as the hotel does not have one. THE WIFI IS GREAT AND WE NEVER HAD A PROBLEM WITH IT JUST CUTTING OUT!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,very helpful staff,location not great”
Reviews.Author: flash50_83
Reviews.Content: Hotel very modern and clean. Staff really friendly and helpful. Roof top pool great especially after days sightseeing. Watch taxis and do not use unless meter is working. Not many resturants near hotel except Papa Rosso which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for a Short Visit”
Reviews.Author: dejay2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early August as a base for exploring Rome and it was the best decision we made! We previously thought about renting an apartment in the city for our time here, but after hours of searching we could not find anything that rivalled the excellent and modern facilities of this hotel! As people have said before the only downside is that the hotel is slightly out of the way (ten minutes on the bus) which we were fully aware of before we booked and decided that is was a compromise we were willing to make and can safely say that it was not a problem for us during our stay. The rooftop terrace and terrace bar is relatively small and only has a handful of loungers, but there is also some space to lay on the decking whilst waiting for them to become available. The swimming pool and hot tub were great (albeit they are remarkably cold - almost unbelievably cold!), however it is well worth braving the initial shock as you soon get used to it. The bar prices were very reasonable, the rooms stylish with extremely comfortable beds, the staff were very friendly and were more than happy to help with any local/tourist information you may need. Also the free wireless & wired internet was an excellent facility, it's a shame more places don't offer it as a standard. If you are arriving via the 170 bus then the best stop to get off at is the third one after going under the flyover as you enter the marconi district, then you just need to cross over the road at the next crossing and walk straight ahead down the intersecting road.

Reviews.Title: “Compromise is the key in Rome”
Reviews.Author: headinthecloudsUK
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a week-long trip to Rome and stayed in this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and elsewhere. Yes, it is a little way out of the city but for that you get less traffic noise and can retreat from Summer heat. Yes, it lacks the character of the traditional buildings closer to the city centre, but then you can have a modern air-conditioned room and the benefits of a rooftop pool. The bus ride to the city centre didn't take too long and the bus stop was only at the end of the road. If you like to see a bit of life beyond the tourist circuit, then travelling on buses is one way of doing it. The pool was a definite plus as the temperatures outside soared to 35C. It was lovely to have somewhere to cool off and relax. They could do with a few more chairs/loungers, but that's a minor detail. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. I got a very good room rate after shopping around and it included breakfast, which we found to be pretty good. I don't know that I would have been prepared to pay an additional breakfast rate, especially with a Spar supermarket within 5 minutes' walk of the hotel, and other supermarkets not far away. I did have the evening buffet on the first evening because it was fairly late and I didn't feel like searching for somewhere. This is my only real criticism - I found it to be overpriced and not a great variety or quality of food. There are some excellent local restaurants in the road parallel to the hotel (Pepe Rosso and the one next to it, particularly; Glamour Cafe was ok but not quite so good) and a wonderful gelataria on the main road just a little further south (banana ice cream was amazing). Try those - the food is great, service attentive and plenty of people-watching opportunities. Much better than the touristy restaurants in the city. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are very comfortable. We did have one disrupted night when a coachload of over-excited German teenagers decided it was fun to run along the corridors shouting, but that was a one-off. In conclusion, if you want to stay somewhere reasonably-priced in Rome, you have to make some compromises. We thought this hotel was very good value and helped to make our stay relaxing as well as interesting. We'd certainly go back (tomorrow if it were possible!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel (Too bad it is in a bad location)”
Reviews.Author: Palaedin4
Reviews.Content: Hotel is more inflexible like a 3 star, but they try and show concern when criticized for less than high performance. Nice rooms, good beds. Neighborhood (even new park next door) covered with grafitti... Internet cuts out a lot, so don't plan any VoIP conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Rome - Present meets the past”
Reviews.Author: Rui_Viajante
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, with my wife, from 16th of July untill the 20th. Excelent hotel. Very clean, confortable, nice staff, good pool... not big, but it had the right size to relax after a long day walking on the sun. The restaurant of the hotel has good food, and the price is reasonable. If you want to spend less money on a meal, you can always eat in the bar. It has good food too... Not so good as the restaurant, but it's good too. They also have a computer room, with free internet access. That's good if you want to send emails to your family and friends and let them know all the details of your stay in Rome. In July the weather is very hot (38º to 40º or more) so be sure to fill your bottle of water in the hotel,before you leave for your sightseeing. All italian tv channels have their shows (movies, and tv shows) in italian. The only english channels available were CNN and BBC news. The hotel is far from the centre of Rome. For me that was good because it was relaxing and quiet. Good for sleeping and resting. Don't worry getting to the places you want to go, because it has a bus stop near the Hotel. Hope this opinion could help you, when you have to choose were to stay, in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel within easy reach of Rome”
Reviews.Author: IncantatoTours
Reviews.Content: If you like modern hotels and don't mind living within a more residential area than the H10 Rome is just the right place for you - and they even offer a free shuttle service. Loved the room decor, the rooftop pool and wonderful breakfast buffet. We look forward to bringing more groups to the H10 in 2011 and I will personally stay there again in the fall. Staff was very friendly and efficent. Free Wifi is also a great plus!

Reviews.Title: “H10 ROMA CITTA THANK YOU”
Reviews.Author: elmadanat1961
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights from the 3rd till the 7th of july 2010, i booked two rooms one for me & my wife the other for my two kids . if you are planning to stay in rome for one or two nights this hotel is a little pet far , but bus No. 170 can take you to termini station , if more than that i think H10 is the best choice . Good value for many. Nice modern hotel , Large rooms with perfect bathroom. Small swimming pool on the roof. Free internet . Rich breakfast . Nice staff . For what you are going to pay i think H10 is the best choice , take my advise now and you can thank me later.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great chain with some need improvements.”
Reviews.Author: fforbes212
Reviews.Content: Fisrt and foremost there is a desk agent his name is Frank .I remembered his name not only because of the great quality of service he provided but also we have the same name.He made my stay at this hotel a lot easier every time I had a problem connecting my iPad with the Internet he tried his best to help.The other good points I love a hotel with hardwood floors ,great amenities ice machine in the hallways with water we also got a comp small bottle of cava nice touch you will see in pics ,and a good sized room.The hotel on coming back from the craziness of the center of Rome always felt like a haven,nice everyday working class Italian neighborhood complete with old itallian women hanging out the window seeing and watching everything.If you want the Roman holiday part of Rome this ain't it,but in saying that it had it's own charm like shopping at the grocery store only a block and half away and having some of the best mozzarella balls I have ever tasted Without the tourist price tag.To get into the main part of Rome you can take the 170 bus directly into Termini or piazza de Argentina .These are all things I figured out on my own and am passing on the knowledge .You can also take the number 8 tram and it will take you 3 blocks from the pantheon and will also take you into the heart of trastevere .It all depends on what kind of experience you want and what your accustomed to.I peronally like a better hotel after a Long day of exploring and walking that will have a nice tub to soak my feet in and on the off day i am tired a little room service is nice.I am from New York City so the transit situation wasn't a biggie for me but for the inexperienced if this is your first trip into Rome I might choose something more central.Personally would I come back to this hotel ..yes p.s upstairs on the roof is a nice sized pool and deck/spa..word to the wise get there early opens at 9am..

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel, very helpful staff speak english.”
Reviews.Author: RDSudzy
Reviews.Content: We checked in early with no problem. Front desk staff spoke english and gave helpful directions. The very nice large room was modern, with glass door to bathroom and a glass shower curtain. Room had a hair dryer, small refrigerator, & large closet. Three blocks to bus stop or hotel shuttle to center of Rome. Take the local train to Trastevere station from airport, or a cab ride was 39 euro from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, stylish”
Reviews.Author: smurfette_1122
Reviews.Content: Stay 4 nights in this hotel. Although is not located in the heart of Rome but is easy to get there by bus even with luggage. Hotel provide me with details direction of how to get there from train station and I have no problem finding it. Not a very big room but bed is very comfortable, best hotel bed I have ever slept in. Free internet which is good. Have a supermarket near by and not expensive. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: OldWorldEurope
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel as part of a vacation package. This was our first trip to Rome and we only had a day and a half to explore the city. The hotel is very nice, very modern and the room was clean and nice size for a European hotel. The hotel is not very close to any of the tourist attractions in Rome and we had to take a bus everywhere we went. We had trouble finding a nice restaurant within walking distance. The break fast was included and had both cold and hot items. The hot items I tried (eggs, bacon, and sausage) were stone cold and not very tasty. The cold items seemed fine. We were travelling with a large group (2 busloads) and the hotel had a problem dealing with this volume at checkin and checkout. Some rooms were not ready until 9 pm and some luggage ended up in the wrong room. The staff seemed somewhat uninterested in providing swift and friendly service. At checkout, there was only 1 person to check all of us and it took way too long. We have travelled extensively in Europe and this hotel was one of the worst for location. I would not recommend this hotel for firsttime travelers or those people who are not independent travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreiapep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, very modern. the staff is very polite and helpful. the rooms are very clean, comfortable, provide great amenities and the bed is reallllyyyyy good, it was very hard to find will to get up. the breakfast is continental you have variety of food that suits different tastes. it's not locate in the centre of Rome however it is very close to bus and train station and you can reach the centre within 10 to 15 minutes. It's very well located to those who wish to have a good rest at night. it has free wireless internet which is a big bonus since it is difficult to find free internet in the main part of other hotels. it also has a shuttle who leaves you in the city centre. I really enjoyed my vacations and this hotel gave a give contribution for that.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: ExeterAnne
Reviews.Content: Well thanks to other reviewers with there tips.This hotel is lovely ,yes its outside the main attractions but only 10 to 15 minutes on the bus number 170 ( 1Euro ).It is in a shopping area with very few restaurants around although we managed to find somewhere to eat .The hotel shuttle bus only takes 15 people so do not rely on catching that ! The supermarket which is at the end of the road ,turn right from front of hotel ,is not visable it is underneath a carpark however the prices are very cheap. If you want to go to the Vatican catch the 766 bus to the train station at trastevere then buy a ticket at the cafe to catch the train to St peters.It will be a 10 minute walk and you will see the dome when you exit the station.We then caught a 64 bus back to the centre of Rome. From Ciampino Airport we caught the bus to Anagnina and the the metro to Termini then the 170 bus to hotel.We purchased the bus and metro ticket at the Airport then the 170 ticket from a news stall at the Termini although you can pay on the bus..The stop is I think called Marconi Fermi you will see a library that looks like a big shop with green writing called feltrinelli.Qite a trip but the cost for two of us was 6 euro 40. Do not have a drink in Piazza Navonna as although fantastic place with plenty going on 2 small lagers cost 18 euros 50 cents !!! The staff at the hotel are great nothing is too much trouble,and the drinks at the bar are not too bad a price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great, but it's just so far”
Reviews.Author: el415
Reviews.Content: Like the title, it's far. It's inconvenient. The shuttle runs 5-6 times a day only, plus it's always full. You can't get in line, because Italians don't wait in lines. You just try to elbow your way in. As Americans we just can't do that, so we walk 10 minutes to the bus stop and ride the bus with many shady characters. But for the price, you can't beat it. It's very new and trendy.

Reviews.Title: “a really good choice...”
Reviews.Author: katerinanz
Reviews.Content: I have read all the reviews about this hotel before booking and after i stayed there during easter i must say a big thanks to all the people strongly recommended it. The hotel is very clean,the room is very comfortable and it has REALLY everything, you don't have to hold not even a toothbruss or toothpaste. I even used the hotel shampoo and it was very good. The hotel lies in a very peaceful and quiet area. We didn;t use the shuttle to the centre once.The bus ticket costs 1 euro and you can keep it for 75 minutes. After exiting the hotel to the right, first turn right and again first turn right.You walk about 150 metres and you find a bus station. All 3 buses go by the trastevere station.Bus No 170 goes to city center and terminates at the termini.The other two stop at trastevere station. So, when arriving at roma, find an information office and take the city guide. Inside it, there is a very small but REALLY HELPFUL MAP with all the bus and metro routes around the city. SO,TAKE BUS No 170 to roma center, or take 170,766 stop at the trastevere station.Then take from there tram No 8.The tram goes by all ''VIA TRASTEVERE''. Via trastevere near the river is full of reastaurants, small bars, actually is the only place in the city we liked to hang around in the evening. Buses are very often, you don't wait more than 7 minutes. Walking to the bus stations, you will find supermarket ''eurospin''.It is open on Sundays as well until 1300 pm.Very cheap supermarket. and i have to mention that the breakfast was very good, and you were not charged for coffee different to american coffee. Their cappucino and espresso were absolutely great. Have a nice staying in rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place just take the shuttle or bus”
Reviews.Author: TravelMuchPlease
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! Wish we could pick it up and put it in the city center for the same price but oh well. The shuttle had good hours and past that the bus was on a great schedule. Definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrBaynham
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, large rooms, clean, quiet, friendly helpful staff and a nice restaurant. One slight issue is that it is a fair way out of the city, 15min drive, you wouldnt walk it. It is not in the greatest area of Rome but they have a courtesy bus which takes you straight into the town, either that or there are plenty of taxis around. Dont let this scare you off though, you probably get much more for your money because it is out of the town centre. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: delfing
Reviews.Content: Typical business look hotel with excellent brand new rooms. The situation is not so good but city centre is reachable by public transport (bus stop less than five minutes) and shuttle available few times a day.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect, even better than i thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: xrisa
Reviews.Content: It is a completely new, beautiful and perfectly clean hotel. I thought that the pictures shown on the intenet were "too good to be true", but when i got there i was really surprised! It was even better. Not far from the center, it has its own bus to get you there and if you don't like the hours of it, you can take the city bus that passes very close to the hotel. I prefered h10 because if you don't want to pay for parking, you can park around the hotel easily and it is safe. Also, the location is not very touristic, so you can find cheap shops and perfect places to eat without being cheated (because you are a tourist...). The personnel is very polite and friendly, always there when you ask for something. The best surprise was that it is the most clean hotel i have ever seen, imagine i didn't use the pillow case and towel I had brought together from my house (clean freak...!). Oh, it also had free wireless and a professional hairdryer!!!! Lastly, I won't forget the extra large and very comfortable bed... you didn't want to get up!!!

Reviews.Title: “But for the location ...”
Reviews.Author: Fortunately
Reviews.Content: The location wrecked it for us. Yes, there is a shuttle, but it was quite competitive to board most of the time. We wound up waiting ages for the bus most of the time during our 5-day stay. The lovely rooms and pleasant staff were not worth the hassle of commuting in and out of the city centre for us. It was fun hanging out by the pool at the end of the day, though sometimes I had to lay on the deck as the loungers were full. The pool was icy cold! Was there supposed to be a roof-top bar open? At least no one complained if you brought drinks from your room. The jacuzzi/hot tub was empty. We have stayed in Rome before, in a centrally-located hotel with roof-top pool and bar, for a similar price, so no, we will not be returning to this hotel. The staff were lovely though. PS: Although seasoned travellers, we were ripped off by our taxi driver from the airport, who switched the 50 euro note we'd just given him for a smaller note and complained we hadn't paid him properly. We were tired from our journey and not expecting an immediate scam. Very young yobs on the bus late one evening were positioning themselves and eyeing my handbag. My husband chased them off. Rome is my husband's favourite city, but be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stellamar
Reviews.Content: New hotel, comfortable rooms, great beds. The breakfast was very good. It is a bit away from the city center, but is within walking distance of bus stop and also has a night bus if someone going to stay until late in the city center. Very near there is supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shanmuga_S_M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good accessible location. Rooms are neat, clean and upmarket. Most of the staff were friendly. But some were not. We asked one of the receptionist about ways to reach airport via local train or location of bus boarding point near Termini. Instead of trying to answering our question, he just offered to book a taxi for us... Due to airport security restrictions, we couldn't bring our toothpaste and this hotel did have toothpaste with them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Murko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the H10 Roma Citta for 4 nights in October 2009 and can not recommend this hotel enough. It was spotless with a comfortable bed and sheets and pillows. The staff were helpful and the hotel is modern and funky. Free internet and computers were provided in the lobby for online check-in etc. The breakfast was 17 Euros per person and we didn't think it was worth it as there are plenty of cafes close by for a pastry and a coffee much cheaper. The hotel provides a shuttle service to and from the centre of room a few times a day. This was helpful otherwise the 170 bus runs through town and we used this a few times. All in all a lovely hotel compared to the usual junk you get in Rome for much more money!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel a bit off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: raymondNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful no matter what the request. The room was modern nicely decorated a good size and very clean. The bathroom is large with a walk-in shower roomy enought for two people. The bathroom also had a hairdryer, shampoo, etc. The only negative thing about the hotel would be the location. It is in a residential area away from Rome Historic Center. However, transportation is readily available and not a problem. The hotel also offers a shuttle should you choose it. What you save on the room cost (compared to a room in Rome center) more than covers the cost of transportation to and from downtown Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lpmaguire
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to start with this hotel, so many good things to say. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by very friendly, helpful, English speaking staff. Although we had arrived three hours before the actual check in time, the staff arranged for our room to be prepared early for us. At check in, we were given lots of information, maps, things to see, advice on eating etc. We also received the free internet username/password. As we walked into our room we were blown away. Everything was in great condition, the bed was huge and comfortable, the bathroom was modern, very clean and had a huge shower. As we had paid £420 each for a week (inc flights), we were amazed to find out that the rooms usually cost €370 per night. After showering and unpacking we decided to head into the centre of Rome. The hotel provides a free shuttle service which runs four times a day. The drop off/pick up point is next to the Roman Forum. From the hotel, the shuttle takes around 10 minutes to get there. One thing to note is that there are only 15 seats available on the shuttle. However, the 170 bus departs from the same location as the pick up/drop off point and that runs until Midnight. The hotel was as described and did not disappoint. The swimming pool on the roof is a great feature. It was great to have a swim in the pool after a long hot day seeing the sights in Rome. There are a limited number of sun beds, but we never had a problem getting one. The hotel also offered a gym which I used a few times. The hotel offers free internet/wifi and has computers located in the bar/lounge area. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel as we ate in Santa Maria in Trastevere. This was a short taxi ride away and has plenty of lovely places to eat. Gino’s in particular, was amazing, and reasonably priced. The only fault we could find with this hotel was that it was not right on top of the sights. However, this was not a problem for us, and it was nice to come away from the busy center. The free shuttle service, and good public transport links, made it easy to reach the sights. Top class hotel, will defiantly return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this one if you are staying in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTony1969
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my 4 night stay at this hotel. Overall, I thought it was a good hotel. They did have a couple of issues that were a bit upsetting but not enough to ruin my trip. First, the hotel is in a residential area and not near the tourist attractions, but they are accesible via the hotel shuttle (which I used a couple of times) and also the #170 bus which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel door. The hotel is off the main road and next to a school and outdoor sports complex. The area is a bit gritty but then again, I thought the whole city was...in other words, lots of graffiti, etc., but at no time did I feel unsafe walking to/from the hotel...and don't kid yourself, if you stay here, you will be doing lots of walking. The hotel was impeccably clean. I was very impressed with the size of the room and the cleanliness. You could literally eat off the floor, anywhere in the hotel. The bathrooms were like something out of a magazine. If you stay here, you'll know what what I mean. The downside - the advertised free wi-fi did not work. I complained several times but was told it happens, depending on where your room is. I personally think that is unacceptable. My room was at the end of the hallway but in today's technological age, they could easily fix this by boosting the signal throughout the hotel. They apparenlty chose not to. If you are staying here for leisure like I did, not a huge problem but it is inconvenient. I couldn't even get online in my room with a wired connection, but they do have free computer access on their lobby computers 24 hours a day...if you are staying for business, you may want to reconsider to a hotel that can guarantee internet. Again, I think they really need to fix this...it's something I read about in other reviews and prepared myself for before arriving. The next thing is the hotel gym...again, it was a disappointment. From day to day the 3 machines in the room (very small room) moved around from one room to another...they claim they were remodeling but with the amount of equipment and size of the room I failed to see what they were trying to accomplish. Luckily, I did so much walking with sightseeing that the gym didn't become much of an issue. The gym and the internet were about the only complaints I have for this hotel...the value is good. If arriving by the train from the airport it will take 25-30 minutes to get to Travestere station...warning, the station is not an eye pleaser...you will wonder what you've gotten yourself in to when you get off at the station but again, it's safe...just not easy on the eyes. The walk to the hotel is easy from the station but will take you 20 minutes...the good news is that you won't need the train station again until you leave...the bus and the hotel shuttle will provide ample transportation...again, the 170 bus will get you to the heart of Rome and you can go from there. As for local amenities...the side street to the hotel has a cute little shop with coffee and pastries which I used daily for breakfast...only a few Euros compared to the overpriced breakfast in the hotel...plus you experience the local life...and there were several pizzarias in the area for lunch/dinner. There is also a couple of small grocery stores for water, etc...(beware that they have fizzy and non fizzy water)...be careful to chose the correct one or you will be surpised when you take a big gulp. Finally, as you exit the hotel and walk to the end of Blaserna where you would normally take a right down to Marconi and the bus stops if you look to the left and across the street you will see a very unassuming building about 3-4 stories tall, with large metal pipes coming down the side (industrial looking)...well, there is a large supermarket in the basement and even a cinema in it...you would never know unless you go exploring like I did...it looked new to me so I hadn't heard about it before in any of the reviews...it's worth a few minutes to explore if for nothing else than the supermarket and snacks for the room. Overall, I would definitely stay here again...the locale gave you the Italian charm but the hotel was modern and comfortable...if you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - pleasantly surprised. Wish we'd stayed longer! Surprisingly good location, close to central Rome!”
Reviews.Author: finn_56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before flying out of Rome FCO, and picked this hotel because it had parking and because it wasn't too far out of the city. II've stayed in Rome many times over the years, so my expectations weren't high - I just wanted somewhere close to some decent restaurants and reasonably clean with a comfy bed for the night before a long flight. We were pleasantly surprised to see exactly how close it is to the center of Trastevere/Rome - it's only about 10 mins in a cab. I was expecting it to be in the middle of nowhere for the price! It's also an absolute bargain in Rome if you like your comforts - even some of the beautiful old 4 and 5 star hotels there don't have all the amenities that American travellers are accustomed to, like plush king beds (not the usual two twins together), lots of pillows, flat screen tv, FABULOUS shower, decent sized rooms etc etc. As it turned out, we were too tired to endure the many courses at the restaurant we wanted, so the hotel staff recommended Retro, which is about two blocks away, and they had wonderful pizza and pasta, and a great atmosphere (lots of locals) with a nice outdoor terrace! Loved it - wished we stayed another day in Rome so we could explore more from this comfortable base - we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: Badams_iyns
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, "mostly" friendly; the young man behind the desk during the day could use a personality, but Deri, the evening concierge was great. He had a lot of great advice. Yes, it's a little bit out of the way, but worth it. Take the shuttle to the city center, then take a cab back late in the evening. We never spent more than 15 euro on a cab, and the rides are a blast. Most times the cabs were 10 or 11 euro. We were was not impressed with the restaurant. Several times I read descriptions saying a Hotel room is large by European standards. I can only compare them to my American standards, and by George the rooms are small. But they were all small in every city we stayed in. We didn't stub any toes and we didn't spend a lot of time at the Hotel anyways. Hints: After exiting the Hotel, turn right and walk up the street, turn right again, and a couple blocks down, you'll see a grocery store. Buy some soda, water, booze and put it in the fridge to save enough money to pay for the cab rides:-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGR1Scotland
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not located downtown, it provided a wonderfully relaxed environment away from the noise and bustle as well as excellent value for money. It's a very new hotel with modern and spotlessly clean accommodation and public areas. Breakfast was not included in the price and is charged at 17 euros for a buffet. It was a good enough selection, even if the price is on the high side. However, compared with a downtown Rome hotel, this offered everything we needed. We were based at the hotel as a film crew and opted to take taxis. Otherwise the hotel provides a shuttle bus service. Although the hotel looks as if it's 'out on a limb' down the street Via Blaserna, in fact, a 7 minute walk will take you to a number of restaurants nearby. I would definitely return to this hotel for a next visit to Rome and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Gazza59Finland
Reviews.Content: Very lovely, new and clean hotel little outside the city center. It was opened as recently as in last December. About 900 € for a week in such a lovely hotel is not much(excellent breakfast incl.) The rooms are big and modern. The bathroom; especially the ceramic tiles were the most beautiful I ever seen. It is a perfect choice for young- or middleaged people for a romantic vacation. Why not for elderly people too, but they must be ready to take the shuttle, taxi or local buss to get to the city center. The free shuttle from the hotel is perfect, but maybe it could come back from the city center a little later? It was easy to take the local train to Trastevere station from the airport and back. The only problem was to know where to get off, because they don` t announce it in the train. The price for the train was 5,50 eur from Fuminese to Trastevere. Getting to the center is easy with the buss 170, it´s running until 24 p.m. everyday. There are busstops at the Marconi street. It takes about 20-25 minutes the get to Termini station by buss. The ticket is only 1 eur, but you must remember to stamp the ticket after byuing it! The same thing before you enter the train. The pool on the hotel roof was perfect after spending a few hours in Vatican, Colosseum or in other historic places. The best hotel I ever stayed in, we are choosing this hotel again if there will be a next time. At least we threw money in the Fountain Trevi for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot outside the main city if that's what you're looking for.”
Reviews.Author: beltainebaby
Reviews.Content: A great hotel...clean, friendly, modern etc. It has a lovely swimming pool on the roof (5th floor) and a outdoor jacuzzi which wasn't in operation but I should assume it will be shortly. There is also a small gym, i.e 1 treadmill, 1 bike, etc. Both are open for use between 7am and 10pm. Its also a 15 minute walk from La Trastevere Station (or a 5 min taxi ride). It is outside the main city which means its a bit quieter. They also run a free shuttle service to and from the city centre on a regular basis thru the day and night. The buffet breakfast looked (I didn't have it) but at Euro 17 a bit expensive for me! Room service was cheaper but limited in their opening times 7am-12.30pm and then only again at 7.30-10pm. Overall the hotel was a great choice for me due to its cleanliness and modern style (amazing bath!!!) but a touch expensive although saying that, it was a decent price compared to the general price of hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bondiemo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - just outside the city centre, but a free shuttle bus runs every day and drops in the historical centre. Staff very helpful. Breakfast is good, but expensive - there are lots of little places close by which are much cheaper. Definitely would recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob-Saldanha
Reviews.Content: Very new, trendy hotel. Not in the city centre but the hotel has a shuttle bus that drops you nearer to the attractions and picks you up - that was really handy. This was the only hotel we stayed in Italy that had free high speed internet (without the need to carry your own laptop). And the staff were all friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: CrunchyGreenHerbiage
Reviews.Content: Interesting arrival, having got off the Paris to Rome overnight train at Termini, it proved impossible to locate a train to Trastevere amongst what seemed like a thousand platforms and no train line maps. In fact the trains are all described with their stops in time order on posters in the station, so it is possible to find them, but after a sleepless night I gave up and took the Metro to Piramide armed with a detailed Michelin map. The walk was less than scenic, with a broken pavement, a metal industrial bridge to cross, graffiti everywhere, and a couple of scrapyards on the way down by the river. I have to admit, I'd wondered what I'd done in booking this hotel. My friend flew into Da Vinci airport from the US and had a totally different experience, easy train ride to Trastevere station, and followed the directions from an earlier review down a shopping street - coming from the other direction he wondered what I'd been talking about. Just saying, if you come in on the Metro, and take the shortest route, don't be put off by the surroundings, the hotel is in a reasonable residential neighbourhood, and we never felt threatened when walking back after dark. The hotel appears as a new building amongst a half built business park and highish apartment blocks, there is a church (with bells) and sports centre next door (with associated yelling and excitement), although there was no irritating noise and it was very quiet at night. Location is very good, it is far enough out of the city centre to be quiet, but it is easy to get to all the tourist spots. Trains and trams from Trastevere station, and the Metro from Piramide cover just about everything; if the worst happens (and we had a tram malfunction resulting in no trams one evening), it is walkable if you're reasonably fit. Figuring out the public transport can be a bit difficult because of the general lack of maps but http://www.atac.roma.it/ can be used to get a route from point a to point b. There is a very large supermarket at the top of the road, and a launderette next door (€4 for a wash, €4 for a dryer - which will need at least two cycles of 24 mins to dry things), there are many local restaurants. The room was spotlessly clean, large, the beds comfy, and the air conditioning worked very well throughout our stay. There is only BBC Worldwide (repeats articles constantly), and CNN English language channels on the tv (do they think we only watch news?), although watching English language films dubbed in Italian and German made for an interesting experience, as did the various sports channels. The curtains are of the blackout variety, so since the lights in the bathroom are very bright, not at all blocked by the glass door, and we didn't want total darkness, we ended up buying a night light to put into the bathroom socket; this gave us just enough illumination to not fall over furniture, and to use the bathroom if we had to get up during the night. The only quibble really with the room were privacy issues with the bathroom, as the door does not lock, is made of glass, and there is a 2cm gap all the way around it. We solved this by using the WCs on the ground floor if there was likely to be any anti-social results of a visit (how do I put that politely?) and by studiously looking the other way when the other person was in the shower if needing to leave the room. We never got up in time for breakfast, but ate two evening meals in the restaurant. These were rather disappointing as there is nothing whatever for vegetarians apart from one starter of pumpkin soup. This resulted in picking pieces of "cattlefish" out of a risotto for one meal, and worse, taking clams (still in their shells) out of a pasta dish in another, there was something crunchy in it (sand?) which was rather nasty and unfortunately it made me rather ill. My friend thought his meal was adequate (he is happy to eat shellfish). Luckily there are numerous restaurants serving extremely tasty and good value meals locally and all over the city, so the hotel restaurant can be reserved for emergency use only, if you don't want to go out again. Obviously I have no idea what the meat dishes were like, so I cannot say that it should be avoided, just don't plan on eating there if you are veggie. The best local restaurant we found, serving amazing wood oven pizzas was Retro, on the main road crossing the top of Pietro Blaserno, it had great service, and was very good value for money. The other gripe we had with the hotel was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities. Looking back we should have just bought a kettle and mugs locally when we found that there was nothing in the room, at the start of our two week stay. I made do with Cappuccinos from the hotel bar and what I could find during the day in Rome, my friend didn't get a cup of tea at all - especially as he brought herbal tea bags - because there was no hot water available anywhere. The staff all spoke excellent English, were unfailingly helpful and polite, and very friendly and welcoming. They even located and gave me access to the room early when I turned up in a bit of a state at 11am on the first day (see first paragraph), said that I could leave late (up to 1400) as my train didn't leave until 1840 on the last day and after that they'd allow me to leave my bags in their left luggage room, and directed me to the nearest pharmacy after I caught a cold in the second week. The chambermaids were very apologetic when they tried to clean the room mid-morning and before we located the door handle tag to let them know we didn't want to be disturbed. After we started using that, they never came to the room until it was removed. All the shampoo, soap and freebies in the bathroom were replenished daily, as were the towels. They were all stars. All in all, we loved staying at this hotel, it made for a very good holiday. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a memorable city break.”
Reviews.Author: JoSapphire
Reviews.Content: The room my partner and I stayed in was cleaned very well each day, was very modern and there was ample room to move around and had excellent wardrobe space. The only downside to the room was that it didn't contain tea or coffee making facilities (which temps you to use the very expensive mini bar). The roof top pool was beautiful and a haven after a day in the city. The staff were very welcoming, spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful. The free shuttle service that the hotel offers saved us a fortune, one day my partner and I did walk into the centre of the city which took approximately 1 hour. Overall I would go back to this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RVMENG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very, very nice. I had a 15 days trip to Italy and it was the best one (but not the most expensive). Very quiet, clean, new and in a nice neighborhood. Free internet and free shuttle for the historic district in Rome. It would be better if they make avaiable a later shuttle to return to hotel (the last one leaves the centre 5:30 PM), but you can take a regular bus if you lose it. I would not recommend the restaurant for dinner. It was very expensive (54 Euros) for 2 and the worst meal that I had in Italy. The breakfast is great, high quality products, but it is the same thing everyday. The park is 20 Euros per day, but I parked in the street in front of the hotel everyday and didn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nico3049
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just arrived back from a four night stay at the H10 hotel, and this is what we would like to report. Although the hotel is outside of the city of Rome, the free shuttle bus took less than 10 minutes journey time in dropping us off in downtown Rome, so no problem there! The location is a mixture of residential and commercial properties but is very quiet. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, especially the reception staff, who always found time to answer any questions that we had. The hotel is very clean, modern and comfortable. Free internet. We found the pool very welcoming after a hard day sightseeing. I feel that the only negative point is that the restuarant in the hotel is a bit on the expensive side (e.g. 17 euro each for breakfast) There is a Spar supermarket within 5 minutes walk, where you can purchase drinks etc, at a fraction of the cost in the hotel. Also we must recommend a nearby restaurant, Pepe Rosso, which is a short walk ( out of the front door of the hotel, right, to the end of the road, right again, first left and it is on the corner of the next junction on your left) Genuine Italian food and nice friendly staff. Good prices. N.B. this is not a tourist area hence the resturant caters for locals. It is also easy to get to the hotel from FCO airport. Train from airport to the termini, then 170 bus to Viale G Marconi (1 euro fare each). Bus drops you at the junction of Via P Blaserna (Foot Locker shop on the corner). Walk down that road, first left and the hotel is about 150 yards down the road). It also works the other way, if you don't want to wait for the shuttle, catch the bus (170)into the city centre for 1 euro each. Also don't be scared to use the Metro system to get round...also 1 euro each per trip, or buy a day ticket for a bit more. Well done H10, great hotel and we had a great time whilst staying there!! Would love to go back someday!!

Reviews.Title: “so wanted to give this 5 *., but ....”
Reviews.Author: the_extra_mile
Reviews.Content: I changed reservations 2 times and eventually settled on H10 for a 2 night stay at beginning August after doing some research - location etc has all been said before and I found to be quite central - a short bus ride from central Rome - so, will tell my experience of my stay.. Arrived at about 10.45 pm - check in was smooth - services explained etc - went up to room - safe not working - went down to reception who said that the maintenance man would be there in the morning - said I had a laptop - which they said they would hold for me - someone from reception came up and reset the safe which seemed to fix it - asked about the restaurant - it closed at 10.30 pm - plan B - room service - it also stops at 10.30pm , plan C - lets have a drink - its now 11.01 pm - receptionist gestured over to someone to ask if we could have 1 drink - no was the answer - I had seen the barman walk past us about 10 seconds earlier - but was told that the bar was now closed - even although there were still about 6 or 7 people finishing drinks - she then said that the bar closed at 10.30 ( all the material in the room says 11 !!) The breakfast selection was fairly basic - there was a small selection of pastries, hams, cheeses and hot items - the bread was sitting in direct sunlight and hardly needed any toasting !! We had breakfast included in our rate otherwise would not have bothered. The room itself is well appointed and has everything you would need including mini bar prices that dont break the bank and free internet access. The bathroom was supplied with good number of toiletries that were fully replenished each day . The overall impression I was left with was that it was playing at being a hotel - despite the modern and stylish decor - the public areas are soul less - I expect a 4* hotel to offer some form of 24 hour room service and a bar that remains open while there is still resident demand.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - good location if you use the puublic bus to dowtown”
Reviews.Author: Pondusen
Reviews.Content: We started out our honeymoon in the H10 Citta (three days). It was a good place to start. Communications to downtown Rome was easy with the 170 public bus right around the corner (didn't even consider the hotel shuttle, which did not seem a good alternative). We never waited more than 10 minutes for the bus either direction. The hotel was clearly new, with a good standard on both rooms and common areas. The sound isolation seemed good, as we were not bothered by noise in the room at all. The pool area on the roof was small but nice. The same can be said of the gym, with two bikes and a treadmill, but it worked for my purpose. We didn't try the hotel breakfast, but bought this on shops in the area. There were two good restaurants close by. We tried the hotel restaurant once. It was goood on atmosphere, but not great on food quality. The personell was service minded, but not experts on explaining directions... There were two bus stops closer than the one they showed us to... Overall, the stay was very good, excellent for the price we paid. I'll probably be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL CANT WAIT TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: thehotelinspector08
Reviews.Content: just returned from a three night stay at this lovely hotel, very modern very clean and really accomodating friendly staff. we wanted a base outside of the hustle of rome, it is in a residential area and it is surronded by apartments a school a church and a new building in construction, having said that it fits a purpose. nice sized very clean fresh bedrooms, comfy beds, nice bathrooms. breakfast was again what you expect nice fresh coffees if you ask for them, selection offresh fruit, pastries cereals yoghurts and a buffet style hot breakfast which by 1015 looked pretty tired. nice points are really friendly staff especially dark haired franseca who alawys smiles and makes you feel comfortable, also you can lie in and turn up at 1025, what a luxury away from the kids. transfer organised by hotel does cost 5 euro more than a cab can charge you- but we were met in the airport so saves the hastle of waiting for a taxi on the subject we found the price of tais to get back to the hotel after midnight pretty horrendous, the meter starts a 6 euro just to close your door and ended up at 19 euro by the time we directed the driver to the hotel , being so new not many drivers have heard of it, the 170 bus was easy to catch at the top of the road and drops in the main centre of rome, only cost 1 euro can be pretty packed late afternoon so expect to feel like you are in a sardine can in 36 degreee weather. didint eat in the hotel plenty of local restaurants in the area, try il spagettarri in the trastevere region really nice fresh food, reasonably priced, and a great winelist of local lazio produced juicy reds. I booked through a uk supermarket website, amazing, asda travel didnt even know they did travel, got a great deal for bed and breakfast the hotel own website was quoting 200 euros we paid under half that. Would def return pool onthe roof was great, could do with some parasols screwed into the decking as there is absolutley no shade up there, but nice and clean fresh water good to relax pre and post a hectic day in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beet this hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jhilden
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel at a great price. The only thing that keeps this hotel from being a 5 star is the location. The location is in a more residential location which we always found to be very safe but if you are looking for a place to eat you probably need to take a cab to a more central part of Rome. Rooms were very clean and quiet. Because you are in a more residential area we were not woken up by traffic at 6am like a lot of other people. We had a very nice king size bed both times we stayed there (3 days apart). The hotel staff spoke excellent english and were very helpful, never rude. The 4 computers in the lobby with free internet were very nice. The pool and hottub on the roof were surprisingly nice, a feature you are definitely not going to find in a hotel in the heart of rome. Because of the distance to nice places for dinner we had dinner once at the hotel restaurant and were surprised at how nice it was. The presentation of the food was exceptional. From Da Vinci airport we took the train (NOT THE EXPRESS TO Termini!) to Trestevere. From there it was a 15 minute walk with our suitcase to the hotel. It's not a bad walk at all. I made the mistake of looking up directions on google maps, well google is wrong about which side of the train station you exit on. When walking to the hotel from Trestevere if you do not go under a bridge within 300 yards of the train station you are going in the wrong direction! Here are the super easy walking directions: 1) Exit Trestevere and go HARD right and follow the wall of the train station. That will lead you to a staircase. 2) Go down the staircase and turn right, this will take you under a bridge. 3) Continue on this road for a few blocks and take a left on Via Pietro Blasern 4) The hotel will be a couple blocks down on your left. It's that easy!

Reviews.Title: “When "new" is charming”
Reviews.Author: H10Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: Most things in Rome are very old. H10 is a very welcome alternative and by far the best kept and most clean hotel I've been to in Rome. The opposite to Hassler Medici at the Sapnish steps which demand premium prices but offer little more than Roman decadence. H10 boasts of modernity and a new Rome, and staying by the nice roof top swimming pool is almost surreal, since it displays the hotel's awkward location in a rather poor residential part of Rome. But H10 does not seem to be bothered by the surroundings. The H10 team seems determined to make an impression, and so they do. Fairly many Spanish tourists (is H10 a Spanish chain?) and the atmosphere is warm yet professional. Indeed a very very good deal in Rome right now and a welcome competition to typical Roman hotels. Especially the breakfast marks the big difference. Very international and NOT typically Italian. Sorry Rome, I still love your charm, it's just that sometimes new things can also be charming - well done H10

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: leechino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night before our cruise. We chose it because of the price and it's quite new. It also has free internet at the lobby. However, it is definitely not walking distance for our family to the center of Rome. We have young and old in our party. If we stayed closer to the center, we would have done and seen more in Rome. Check-in was a bit slow but staff was friendly. We ate dinner at their restaurant and food was mediocre and pricey. Overall, the stay was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: yeahmui
Reviews.Content: I was so glad that I had stayed in this hotel during my stay in Rome. The hotel is closer to the event venue (EUR area) but it only took 15 minutes to go to city centre (they also provided shuttle bus service to city centre as well). The hotel is clean, modern and most important of all, they have a swimming pool (outdoor) on the top floor (5th floor) of the hotel. In addition, their room rate is very attractive comparative with other hotels in Rome. Thanks for their staff - Yolanda, Manuela and Antonio at the reception area who had given me a lot of assistance during my stay. Very happy stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mousekin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Roma Citta and had a nice stay there. It is a lovely, modern hotel, excellent rooms and the beds are lovely and huge. The pool on the roof top whilst small, is lovely after you have been sight seeing all day, you pay a deposit of 15 euros each for a towel which is returned to you as you leave and return the towel. Shame there is not a bar up there though! and there are no umbrellas. There is only 1 English channel on the tele, not that you will be in your room much i expect, but just letting you know. The breakfast is expensive as the last person stated 17 euros! but there is a bakery up the road and a Spar supermarket to get food if you want. The view around the hotel is not the best as there is some building work currently going on opposite the hotel, but it is not too bad at all in terms of noise. In fact the hotel is pretty peaceful. The bar shuts at 10pm which was a shame and was a suprise. They have a shuttle bus 4 times day but please note the last one back is at 5pm from the Centre. The 170 bus goes to and from near the hotel into the centre and does not cost much. A taxi into the centre costs around 10 euros plus, depending which part of rome you want to go to, generally 10 euros to the Coluseum. The hotel is very good value, just be prepared to use the buses etc into town. The only thing i would say is that as the hotel is pretty new, the ambience is yet to develop if that makes sense? if you get a taxi, make sure you have change as one of the drivers pretended he had none, so this forced us having to give him a fare sized tip! i would recommend this hotel for the price you pay. It cost 45 euros to Ciampino airport in a private taxi and is about half an hour away. Oh and try the Argentinian restaurant Bavira (i think) there are 2 of them one near Piazza Nirvona and the other near the Coluseum, great steaks! half a caraf of wine is only 3 euros! simple food though. but tasty and the restaurant facing the Pantheon has lovely staff and an amazing location at night.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, MODERN, LARGE ROOMS, EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TERESAMARIA
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travellers I stayed at H10 Roma Citta for 10 days as a solo traveller in a double room. The hotel was opened in November, 2008 and is ultra modern.
