Rooms: Large Huge bed, comfortable air- conditioning brand new plasma televison 15-21 channels - 2 english as in news large bathroom & shower(2 shower heads), water excellent Location: Excellent location, not far out as everyone has indicated. Yes, hotel is not close to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc., but only a bus ride away to get to the centre of Rome approximately 15 to 20 minutes. The bus to take you into Rome is bus #170 or you can choose the shuttle @ the hotel which leaves at two different times in the morning and returns @ two different times in the evening. So, my suggestion, take the shuttle into town, and take the bus to return to hotel, if you are unsure how long you will stay in the city. Also, there are bank machines, pharmacy, banks, cafe & bakery shops, shopping stores(clothes/shoes), supermarkets, esthetics to get your hair and nails done all within walking distance and 5 mintues from the hotel. Whoever said this hotel was far from everything has not made a correct assessment. Close or 5 minutes from the famous Trastevere district known for the best places to eat in Rome! Restaurants: One restaurant with a menu of limited choices but a bit of everything Food is good, you should try it for one meal as it is more fun to venture out in the city for dinner. Bar in the main lobby - excellent service - drinks and coffee Breakfast - not included cost to include $17.00 Breakfast to be served in room $17.00 + $4.00 I chose to not have breakfast, and I went outside the hotel for breakfast Lobby: Couches everywhere to sit for many people Large plasma television for everyone to watch with all the channels Internet: 4 computers with free internet access unlimited (just key in your user id & password provided by reception @ check in I highly recommend this hotel, and I would rather stay @ this hotel than stay in an old, small hotel in the centre of Rome for the same price. It's actually refreshing to return from the center to this hotel and area of the city. Amenities: Moderate sized pool on the roof with deck which is fabulous to cool off, view of the condos in the area. Gym: dumbbells with light weights, not sufficient, therefore best to work out when you get back home or do a lot of walking in the city! Room Service available Fridge in the room Phone & hair dryer Safe all modern excellent quality Emanuela @ front desk very knowledgeable & helpful You can request a taxi to go to the airport $40.00 - the hotel will order it + give you a wake up call

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Fresh Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dmgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only 6 months old but it was a hotel that would return to. It had a lovely clean freshness about the hotel, with a great open reception area. The bar was good value, with attentive staff. The rooms were excellent, with every mod con that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The swimming pool and gym were small but served a purpose, especially when you would want to either get ready in the morning or to refresh and relax after a hot day in the centre of Rome. The only negative aspect was that it was surrounded by high rise resitential flats, so there were no views of any sights. The train station was a 10 min walk away which served the airport and the centre of Rome. The price, level of service, facilities and the standard of rooms make this an excellent hotel for discovering Rome without ruining your wallet. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel either with friends, families or your loved one!

Reviews.Title: “charming new hotel in less than charming area”
Reviews.Author: Dressygirl
Reviews.Content: check out the deals online at this chain. Three of us stayed there in two rooms over Memorial Day weekend for less than $100/night. though hard to find and about a 10 minute walk frm the Trestavere train station, this five month old hotel has a modern vibe, lovely staff, free internet on the four computers in the lobby, and free wi-fi, which unfortunately did not work in our room (but did outside in the hallway). A lovely pool and jacuzzi opened the Saturday we were there, on the fifth floor roof, and it was terrific to wallow an hour up there after a day of traipsing through the Vatican. We did not get the breakfast included, as there are several pastry shops up the street. It looks like two hotels are going up across the street so perhaps this area will one day be "up and coming". There is a hotel shuttle that goes to Rome center city four times a day, two in the morning, two in the afternoon, but the times did not work for us. We got a great tip from a front desk clerk -- walk (or take the 170 or 781 bus) to Trestavere Station, cross the street and catch the #8 tram that takes you to Trestavere itself (the last stop before crossing the river). You can also take it to the end and it will drop you off in city center Rome, within walking distance of all the tourist attractions. What no one told us was that ABSOLUTELY NO ONE PAYS TO RIDE THE TRAINS, BUSES OR TRAMS. We had a Roma Pass and when we used it the first time people looked at us like we were nuts. Consequently, we did not pay the 5.5 Euros when we returned to the airport; no one checks tickets. We walked from the train station late at night and never felt uneasy, but you are a good 20 minutes from the action in Trestavere and about 1/2 hour from Rome city center. The hotel itself is very Italian modern, with large rooms, a very large bathroom with excellent shower heads, a bidet, and lots of extras such as toothbrushes, combs, shampoo, lotion, shower gel, and sewing kits provided, along with soap. Nice think towels, but no washcloths, but two different hand towel sizes. The TV is a flat screen, with CNN, BBC and stations in french, spanish, italian and other languages. There is a small bar and the bartender (I think he was named Mauro) made the best Rossine (champagne and rasberries?) we had. the problem is there seemed to be only one bartender to make the drinks and to wait on people sitting in the lounge, as well as provide drinks and coffee for meeting areas and room service. We did not eat in the restaurant but it looked quite elegant. someone told us the H10 property in Barcelona goes for 350/night, so try this place out while it's new and looking for business.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel value but a little out of the way but in a great Neiborhood in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FrankC223
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the H10 Roma Citta hotel a very modern hotel out side of Rome. it was a great find but if your not willing to take buses to get to the sights then this is not for you. The hotel offers a shuttle bus to the main area of Vieneza Piazza but if you plan on staying late in Rome the bus schedule was not good. but this hotel is way so modern and and excellent price value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - no gym or pool yet but easy reach of main city”
Reviews.Author: billynicol
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews we decided to stay at H10 in Rome. Like other people it was a bit of an orientation exercise getting to the hotel from Trastavere station (30 minutes from Leonardo airport). (Remember to validate the train ticket 5.50 Euros before getting on the train) But once there it was a comfortable and luxurious experience for the price. The 170 bus took about 20 minutes and the hotel lays on a free shuttle to the centre at 930, 11am and then twice in the afternoon, so all in all very easy to get around. The area the hotel is in is not that pretty, but then the cost and quality of the hotel make up for this as does the consistently helpful and friendly attitude of the staff. When we arrived the TV wasn't working, the safe would not lock and my adapter didnt fit!!! Each time I asked for help the 'technician' was sent and fixed things within 10 minutes. You cant get better. The bed was a 7ft by 7 ft 'king' size, the likes of which I have never seen before!!! Wonderful. The bathroom had a huge bath and a wonderful shower and bidet. Rome itself is beautiful and takes your breath away. It gets very hot and I wouldn't recommend the open top bus tours at all, they cover the same route that we walked. Once you get bearings, you can walk to the Vatican from the city centre (Piazza de Venizia/Via del Corso) within about 30 minutes, or the Coloseum in about 10 minutes. You can get a ticket for a few days or a week that covers the buses, trams and local trains (a week was 16 Euros). If you take a taxi it costs about 12 Euros to the hotel (once the find where it is as it was only built in December 2008). Wonderful, if you don't mind a little adventure getting there and a short trip on a sometimes crowded bus post-adventure!!!!! The transfer teh Fumencino airport is a set fee of 40 Euros and takes about 20-30 mins ordered at reception. Would recommend to anyone who doesn't mind a bit of exercise and finding a way around.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is where??”
Reviews.Author: GNJL
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and room are lovely but it seems plunked down in the middle of nowhere. It's a very sketchy gritty neighborhood. We had such a hard time finding the place, yes, it's a 15 minute walk but not when you are carrying 2 large suitcases from the train station. It's 700 meters, which is the equivalent of a little over 6 football fields. When you walk out of the train station, you need to get your bearings. Make a right turn out of the entrance and go along the side of the building. At the end of the sidewalk in front of the building, about 10 yards away, there is a staircase that takes you down to the street level. Go down the stairs. Make another right turn, and go underneath a scary overpass (complete with various persons in a homeless state). Then you keep going for about 1/2 mile. You will pass a street called Via Albert Einstein. A few blocks up is the Via Pietro Blaserna, make a left. It doesn't look like there is a hotel anywhere around. You have to keep going about 3 blocks down, then make a left turn, and go down about another block to the actual hotel itself. After a long day of sightseeing, we took the #170 bus back, the stop is on the main street, few blocks from the hotel. It's the 12th stop but since the buses don't make every stop, ask the driver which one you want to get off at and the driver will let you know. Took about 20 minutes without traffic. Was nice to go back to a clean and comfortable room and take a hot shower with good water pressure. And the hotel has free wifi and 4 computers you can use, which is nice. Since we were staying there one night to catch an early morning flight home, we didn't mind it too much but it was an adventure getting there. And don't bother looking up directions on Google Maps, it's practically worthless in Europe. If we were staying for a few days, we would probably stay somewhere in the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Location Fine”
Reviews.Author: Jase079
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The local station is called Trastervere where frequent trams (no 8) travel to and from the city centre (basically a 5 min walk from the Pantheon) The tram stop is 700 meters from the hotel and if you think that’s far, just wait until you go to the Vatican. The tram takes about 10 mins to get you in the heart of Rome. Trastervere station also has frequent trains to the airport so no need for expensive taxis either. The hotel was very clean, the only complaint we have is that the swimming pool was closed as the rooftop area looked great. The room has everything you need in it, very clean and quiet at night, we recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a trip to Rome. The location is not bad at all, we tended to catch the 11AM bus provided by the Hotel into Rome and get the tram back later on. We found a great restaurant on Via Enrico Fermi, which is a street away from the Hotel and others up near Trastervere station, Gusto cooking school is also a stones throw away and this is featured in all Rome tourist guides for foodies. Hotel lacked atmosphere when we arrived, but we never eat in hotels anyway. Book this if you don’t mind a short 10 minute 700m walk to get to the tram stops near Trastervere, if you want to stay on top of the sites in the city centre then be prepared for loud, noisy nights as its permanently packed. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie4ver
Reviews.Content: Like every hotel, it has it's pluses and minuses. Since this trip was not really planned we decided to stay less than 5-4 star hotels. And considering price this was a good choice. Hotel is new, so looked pretty good, though we had problems with the safe. The BR was very minimum whatever 4 star hotel can offer. I read in other reviews that it's very-very good, and I was surprised that this BR people call "very-very good". If you are on budget my recommendation will be to eat somewhere else. It's not worth 20 Euros. Everyone knows about the location, it's not really good. I was surprised to see many stores in this neighborhood, but anyway the prices are high. We couldn't find near by also a good restaurant. The front desk employees looked to me not really knowledgeable and professional. Sometimes we felt that they don't understand English, or just really don't know the neighborhood. 5 mins walking was in reality 20 mins fast walking. This hotel was fine, just looks very dead and empty. No activities in the evening, at the bar, restaurant. Fitness center was very small - only 3 machines, jacuzzi and pool were outdoor and didn't work. But we had free fast Internet, which was great. Overall - what you pay is what you get. I don't regret that we didn't stay in the Center of Rome cause some of the 4-5 star hotels look really crappy. We wouldn't enjoy it for double or triple price for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel that is a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: Booklust
Reviews.Content: The hotel was brand new - very nice inside. The staff was helpful. The wifi was free. The experience inside the hotel was fantastic. The major challenge was that it was a bit far out and even taxis don't know about it yet. The free shuttle they provided were not frequent enough (four per day - two in the morning and two in the afternoon) and there were way more passengers than the 15 seats. We arrived 15 minutes before the scheduled shuttle and there were more than 10 people there already. There was no system as to how the seats then would be assigned so there was a mad rush. There are public buses, but didn't run very often on Sundays and holidays. Taxi ride into the main part of Rome was about 15-20 euros on way. Overall it was a great hotel, but just need to factor the distance in your decision making.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Smithby
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this property and i will come back in June with my family. Spacious rooms, good food and staff very helpful. I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monkeys311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal! We got a discounted rate right after the hotel opened and were not sure what to expect. The hotel surpassed our expectations. The rooms are very nice and the staff was extremely helpful. There was a pool and hot tub on the roof and a nice little fitness room. The only drawback was the location. It is south of the center of the city and there is not a lot of nightlife or restaurants near the hotel. However, the hotel offers a free shuttle into the center of the city everyday. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, and comfortable hotel 4 km away from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Jetten
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time browsing the internet for a modern and affordable hotel close to the centre of Rome, having had some poor hotel experiences on previous trips. It was really hard to find anything, and even the expensive hotels had rather poor reviews. Finally I bumped into the H10. The hotel pictures, reviews, and modest prices stood out above everything else, so I decided to give it a try. It was a good choice. As other reviewers have remarked, the hotel is brand new and stylishly decorated: everything works and is clean and in good shape. The beds are very comfortable both for sitting and sleeping, with my only complaint that I found the duvet a bit too hot (but as there is no noise on the street you can leave the window open, or alternatively turn on the aircon or take off the duvet and use just the blanket). Bath and shower are modern and in good shape like the rest of the hotel, with good water pressure and temperature. Other pros of this hotel are the free wifi service throughout the building, 5 free computers in the lobby (alas no printers), and the cooked-to-order eggs and bacon for breakfast. The bar also looked stylish and cosy, but seems to close rather early at night. The only issue about this hotel is its location: it's in a residential area, about 4 km South of the city centre or 2 km South of the Trastevere area, which is popular for its bars and restaurants. It's too far to walk. There is a bus stop at 5 minutes walk from the hotel (bus 170), and it takes 15-20 minutes to reach the terminus at Piazza Venezia. A taxi costs around 15 euros. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to the city centre, but it only leaves 5 times per day at fixed hours so it's not very useful. I have to add that personally I found the travel no problem at all, and I even enjoyed seeing a non-touristy part of Rome. But it does make it less convenient to quickly pop by your hotel if you should forget something or want to take a short rest. If you're travelling to the hotel from Rome's main Airport (Fiumicino) then DO NOT take the Leonardo da Vinci Express to Roma Termini, but rather take the normal train to Roma Trastevere station. From there it's a 10-15 minute walk or a short bus/taxi ride to the hotel. The train journey takes 30 minutes (just like the Express) and it's half as cheap at 5,50 euros rather than 11 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice ! Best deal in Rome ! I'll be back !!!”
Reviews.Author: vanillagxg
Reviews.Content: After, let's say, a week of searchin' the best deal in Rome - I decided to try this hotel ! A wise decision for our stayin' in the middle of feb 2009 ! The hotel is brand new fresh, opened in 19 dec 2008, it smells all over like a garden of flowers ! In a few words : best quality furniture ( those people aren't cheap at anything) , plenty of food at breakfast (I'm the fruits and cereals man but I saw almost everything there), well positioned - not downtown but the area is really quiet and walls are soundproof (a rare thing in Rome) , helpful and professional stuff, very clean, a real king size bed - the cherry on top after a day of walking throughout Rome ... What pleased us most : 1. from the beginning, even we came early because of the flight schedule, the receptionist - Mr. Marco B. made possible our early check in ! This was very nice ! 2. I can say and prove - the hotel looks better than in pictures ! This was always a surprise, most of the hotels, hire professional photographers to make wood look like gold if u know what I mean ... 3.The room has anything u want even if it's not very big ! The wardrobe is huge, u can put there even your two big suitcases ! It makes you feel like you really are in 2009 in Rome - modern furniture assorted with good taste, it's a very warm athmosphere ! 4. The restaurant personnal is very custom oriented, they are extremely polite and helpful without being annoying ! They really care ! 5.The area in the Marcony district is a quiet one, except the church bells (not in a bad way ...), there is nothing you can here from outside ! Very close is a shopping area with good prices at everything ! And if you want to go downtown, the 170 bus leaves you in maximum 15 min in Venice Square on the Capitolian Hills- the heart of the historical centre ! ... What can I say, I'm very happy I stayed in this hotel ! And I will definetly come back in the future ! I recommand it to you with warm feelings ! You won't regret that !

Reviews.Title: “I love the h10!”
Reviews.Author: willifogg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in H10 Roma last week and had such a wonderful stay! it is not located in city center, but you can reach it in less than 15 minutes by public transportation. hotel is perfect, staff are so kind and rooms are amazing. is super clean and bright. Thought they have just opened, it looks like they will have a great future, as it is very difficult to find such a high class quality hotel in rome. definetely we will be back!

HotelInfo.Name: H10 Roma Citta
HotelInfo.Address: Via Pietro Blaserna 101, 00146 Rome, Italy
